  3949                                  ; 20/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (combined kernel)
  3950                                  
  3951                                  
  3952                                  ; 19/03/2018
  3953                                  ; Retro DOS v2.0 (24/02/2018)
  3954                                  ; [REF: MSDOS 3.3, MSBIO, "MSINIT.ASM"  (24/07/1987)]
  3955                                  
  3956                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3957                                  ;									:
  3958                                  ;	System initialization						:
  3959                                  ;									:
  3960                                  ;	The entry conditions are established by the bootstrap		:
  3961                                  ;	loader and are considered unknown. The following jobs		:
  3962                                  ;	will be performed by this module:				:
  3963                                  ;									:
  3964                                  ;	1.	All device initialization is performed			:
  3965                                  ;	2.	A local stack is set up and DS:SI are set		:
  3966                                  ;		to point to an initialization table. Then		:
  3967                                  ;		an inter-segment call is made to the first		:
  3968                                  ;		byte of the dos 					:
  3969                                  ;	3.	Once the dos returns from this call the ds		:
  3970                                  ;		register has been set up to point to the start		:
  3971                                  ;		of free memory. The initialization will then		:
  3972                                  ;		load the command program into this area 		:
  3973                                  ;		beginning at 100 hex and transfer control to		:
  3974                                  ;		this program.						:
  3975                                  ;									:
  3976                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3977                                  		
  3978                                  		; 20/12/2022
  3979                                  		; ----------------------
  3980                                  		; Registers
  3981                                  		; ----------------------
  3982                                  		; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  3983                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  3984                                  		; DS = 0, ES = 0, SS = 0
  3985                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  3986                                  		; SP = 700h
  3987                                  		; ----------------------
  3988                                  		; CX = 0				
  3989                                  
  3990                                  ; 02/10/2022 - 20/12/2022
  3991                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3992                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  3993                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  3994                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  3995                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  3996                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 70h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  3997                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector and then MSLOAD sets this).
  3998                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3999                                  
  4000                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4001                                  ;
  4002                                  ;;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4003                                  ;;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4004                                  ;;	data sector of the bios.
  4005                                  ;
  4006                                  ;		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4007                                  ;		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4008                                  
  4009                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4010                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4011                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4012                                  
  4013                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4014 0000165B FA                      		cli
  4015                                  
  4016 0000165C 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4017 0000165D 07                      		pop	es
  4018                                  		;push	cx
  4019                                  		;push	di
  4020                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4021 0000165E B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4022                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4023                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4024                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4025 00001660 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4026                                  next_int_:		
  4027 00001663 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4028 00001664 AC                      		lodsb		
  4029                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4030 00001665 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4031 00001666 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4032 00001668 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4033 0000166A 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4034 0000166C 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4035                                  					; saving address in di
  4036                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4037                                  		;stosw
  4038                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4039                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4040                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4041 0000166E A5                      		movsw
  4042 0000166F A5                      		movsw		
  4043                                  
  4044 00001670 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4045 00001672 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4046                                  		
  4047                                  		;pop	di
  4048                                  		;pop	cx
  4049                                  
  4050                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4051                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4052                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4053                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4054                                  
  4055                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4056                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4057                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4058                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4059                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4060                                  
  4061                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4062 00001674 C7064C00[4F07]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4063                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4064                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4065 0000167A 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4066                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4067 0000167E C7065400[FE07]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4068                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4069                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4070 00001684 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4071                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4072 00001688 C7066400[BE07]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4073                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4074                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4075 0000168E 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4076                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4077                                  
  4078                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4079 00001692 0E                      		push	cs
  4080 00001693 1F                      		pop	ds
  4081                                  		
  4082 00001694 A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4083 00001697 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4084 0000169A A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4085 0000169D A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4086                                  					; ;
  4087 000016A0 FB                      		sti
  4088 000016A1 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4089                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4090                                  
  4091                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4092                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4093                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4094                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4095                                  ;
  4096                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4097                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4098                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4099                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4100                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4101                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4102                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4103                                  
  4104                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4105                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4106                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4107                                  ;
  4108                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4109                                  ; to do anything special.
  4110                                  ;
  4111                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4112                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4113                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4114                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4115                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4116                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4117                                  
  4118                                  		; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4119 000016A3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  4120                                  
  4121                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4122 000016A5 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4123                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4124 000016A7 751F                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4125                                  
  4126                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4127                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4128                                  ;
  4129                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4130                                  ;
  4131                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4132                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4133                                  
  4134                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4135                                  		;push	ax
  4136                                  		;push	bx
  4137                                  		;push	cx
  4138 000016A9 52                      		push	dx
  4139                                  		;push	di
  4140 000016AA 06                      		push	es
  4141 000016AB B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4142 000016AD B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4143 000016AF CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4144                                  					; DL = drive number
  4145                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4146                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4147                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4148 000016B1 7202                    		jc	short _gdskp_error
  4149                                  		;;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4150                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4151                                  		; ds = cs
  4152                                  		;mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4153 000016B3 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  4154                                  _gdskp_error:	
  4155                                  		; 20/12/2022			
  4156 000016B5 07                      		pop	es
  4157                                  		;pop	di
  4158 000016B6 5A                      		pop	dx
  4159                                  		;pop	cx
  4160                                  		;pop	bx
  4161                                  		;pop	ax
  4162                                  		
  4163 000016B7 720F                    		jc	short normalfloppydrv
  4164                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4165                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4166                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4167                                  		; ds = cs
  4168                                  		;cmp	byte [flp_drvs], 0
  4169                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4170                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4171                                  		;;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4172                                  		;mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4173                                  		;;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4174                                  		;; 18/12/2022
  4175                                  		;dec	ax
  4176                                  		;jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4177                                  		
  4178                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4179 000016B9 08C9                    		or	cl, cl ; [flp_drvs]
  4180 000016BB 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv		
  4181 000016BD 49                      		dec	cx	
  4182 000016BE EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4183                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4184                                  
  4185                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4186                                  		;20/12/2022
  4187                                  		; ds = cs
  4188 000016C0 FEC1                    		inc	cl	; cl = 1
  4189 000016C2 880E[8D15]              		mov	[fakefloppydrv], cl ; 1
  4190                                  		;mov	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1		
  4191                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4192                                  					; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4193                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4194                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4195 000016C6 EB0A                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4196                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4197                                  
  4198                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4199                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4200                                  		;rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4201                                  		;rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4202 000016C8 D0C1                    		rol	cl, 1
  4203 000016CA D0C1                    		rol	cl, 1
  4204                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4205                                  		;;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4206                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4207                                  		;and	al, 3
  4208                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4209 000016CC 80E103                  		and	cl, 3
  4210 000016CF 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4211                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4212 000016D1 41                      		inc	cx
  4213                                  		;inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4214                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4215                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4216                                  		; ds = cs
  4217 000016D2 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4218                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4219                                  notsingle:	
  4220                                  		; 20/12/2022			
  4221                                  		;inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4222                                  		;			; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4223                                  		;			; booted off hard file
  4224                                  		;mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4225                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4226 000016D6 FEC1                    		inc	cl	; cl >= 2
  4227                                  
  4228                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4229                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4230                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4231                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4232                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4233                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4234                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4235                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4236                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4237                                  
  4238                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4239                                  
  4240                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4241 000016D8 88C8                    		mov	al, cl	; 26/05/2019
  4242                                  
  4243 000016DA F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4244 000016DD 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4245 000016DF 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4246                                  gothrd:					
  4247                                  
  4248                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  4249                                  ;   ax = 0-based drive we booted from
  4250                                  ;   bios_l, bios_h set.
  4251                                  ;   cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4252                                  ;   ch = media byte
  4253                                  
  4254                                  ; Retro DOS 4.0 - 27/12/2018 
  4255                                  ;  (from Retro DOS v2.0 boot sector)
  4256                                  ;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4257                                  ;   dh = media byte
  4258                                  
  4259                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4260 000016E1 88F5                    		mov	ch, dh		; 01/07/2018
  4261                                  
  4262                                  		; cl = number of floppies
  4263                                  		; ch = media byte
  4264                                  
  4265                                  		; set up local stack
  4266                                  
  4267                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4268                                  		;xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4269                                  					; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4270                                  					; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4271                                  					; ch = media byte
  4272                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4273                                  		; es = ds = cs
  4274                                  		; ss = 0
  4275                                  		; sp = 700h
  4276                                  
  4277                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4278                                  		;cli
  4279                                  		;mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4280                                  		;mov	sp, 700h
  4281                                  		;sti
  4282                                  
  4283 000016E3 51                      		push	cx ; (***) 	; save number of floppies and media byte
  4284                                  		
  4285 000016E4 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4286 000016E6 50                      		push	ax ; (**)	; save boot drive number and media byte
  4287                                  		
  4288                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4289                                  
  4290 000016E7 B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4291 000016E9 CD15                    		int	15h	; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4292 000016EB 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4293 000016ED 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4294 000016F0 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4295                                  
  4296                                  ;		; 20/12/2022
  4297                                  ;		; (Programmer's Guide to the AMIBIOS, page 268)
  4298                                  ;		; (https://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_15-c0.html)
  4299                                  ;
  4300                                  ;		INT 15h, ah = C0h - Return System Configuration Parameters (PS/2 only)
  4301                                  ;
  4302                                  ;		on return:
  4303                                  ;		CF = 0 if successful
  4304                                  ;		   = 1 if error
  4305                                  ;		AH = when CF set, 80h for PC & PCjr, 86h for XT
  4306                                  ;	     	    (BIOS after 11/8/82) and AT (BIOS after 1/10/84)
  4307                                  ;
  4308                                  ;		ES:BX = pointer to system descriptor table in ROM of the format:
  4309                                  ;
  4310                                  ;		Offset Size	     Description
  4311                                  ;
  4312                                  ;		  00   word   length of descriptor (8 minimum)
  4313                                  ;		  02   byte   model byte (same as F000:FFFE, not reliable)
  4314                                  ;		  03   byte   secondary model byte
  4315                                  ;		  04   byte   BIOS revision level (zero based)
  4316                                  ;		  05   byte   feature information, see below
  4317                                  ;		  06   dword  reserved
  4318                                  
  4319                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4320                                  		; ds = cs
  4321 000016F2 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_modelbyte]
  4322 000016F6 A2[3606]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4323                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  4324                                  					; get/save model byte
  4325 000016F9 268A4703                		mov	al, [es:bx+3]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte]
  4326 000016FD A2[3706]                		mov	[secondary_model_byte], al
  4327                                  		;mov	[cs:secondary_model_byte], al
  4328                                  					; get/save secondary model byte
  4329 00001700 EB0C                    		jmp	short turn_timer_on
  4330                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4331                                  
  4332                                  no_rom_system_conf:			
  4333 00001702 BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh
  4334 00001705 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
  4335                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4336 00001707 26A00E00                		mov	al, [es:0Eh]	; get model byte (from 0FFFFh:0Eh)
  4337 0000170B A2[3606]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4338                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al ; save model byte
  4339                                  turn_timer_on:				
  4340 0000170E B020                    		mov	al, 20h	; ' '   ; turn on the timer
  4341 00001710 E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.
  4342                                  					; AKPORT
  4343                                  
  4344                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications
  4345                                  ; chip installed at io address 50h and 52h. if we're running
  4346                                  ; on one of those, we must inhibit the normal aux port initialization
  4347                                  
  4348                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4349                                  		; ds = cs
  4350 00001712 803E[3606]00            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0
  4351                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0 ; next to last	byte in	rom bios
  4352 00001717 7510                    		jnz	short not_olivetti_m24 ; skip for all other machines
  4353                                  					; (except olivetti m24)
  4354 00001719 E466                    		in	al, 66h		; is 8530 installed?
  4355 0000171B A820                    		test	al, 20h
  4356 0000171D 740A                    		jz	short not_olivetti_m24 ; we're done if not
  4357 0000171F B00F                    		mov	al, 0Fh		; double check
  4358 00001721 E650                    		out	50h, al
  4359 00001723 E450                    		in	al, 50h
  4360 00001725 A801                    		test	al, 1		; this test was	copied from olivetti
  4361 00001727 7414                    		jz	short skip_aux_port_init ; take	this branch if 8530 installed
  4362                                  
  4363                                  not_olivetti_m24:
  4364 00001729 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; init com4
  4365 0000172B E83108                  		call	aux_init
  4366 0000172E B002                    		mov	al, 2		; init com3
  4367 00001730 E82C08                  		call	aux_init
  4368 00001733 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; init com2
  4369 00001735 E82708                  		call	aux_init
  4370 00001738 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; init com1
  4371 0000173A E82208                  		call	aux_init
  4372                                  
  4373                                  skip_aux_port_init:			
  4374 0000173D B002                    		mov	al, 2		; init lpt3
  4375 0000173F E81508                  		call	print_init
  4376 00001742 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; init lpt2
  4377 00001744 E81008                  		call	print_init

  4425                                  ;		50:00	byte	Print screen status byte

  4433                                  ;		50:10	word	BASICs default DS value (DEF SEG)
  4434                                  ;		50:12	dword	Pointer to BASIC INT 1C interrupt handler
  4435                                  ;		50:16	dword	Pointer to BASIC INT 23 interrupt handler
  4436                                  ;		50:1A	dword	Pointer to BASIC INT 24 disk error handler

  4439                                  ;		50:30	4bytes	MODE command

  4698                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  4699                                  ; diskette drives:
  4700                                  ;
  4701                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  4702                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  4703                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  4704                                  ;
  4705                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  4706                                  ;
  4707                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  4708                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  4709                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  4710                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  4711

  4722                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  4723                                  
  4724                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  4725                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  4726                                  
  4727                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  4728                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  4729                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  4730                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  4731                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  4732                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  4733                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  4734                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  4735

  4739                                  					; di <-	first bds link

  4741                                  					; di <-	second bds link
  4742 00001860 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; -1 ; set end of link

  4771                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  4776                                  ; in this case, we are going to put bogus informations to bds table.
  4777                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when

  4780                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.

  5042                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5043                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5044                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5045                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5059                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5060                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5061                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5062                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5063                                  ;
  5064                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5065                                  ;
  5066                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5067                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5068                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5069                                  ;use to start with.
  5070                                  ;
  5071                                  ;secondly, "dynamic configuration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5072                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5073                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5074                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5075                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5076

  5144                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5145                                  
  5146                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5147                                  ;
  5148                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5149                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5150                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5151                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5152                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5153                                  ; off of it.
  5154                                  ;
  5155                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5156                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5157                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5158                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5159                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5160                                  
  5161                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5162                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5163                                  checkcompaqbug:
  5164                                  		; 20/12/2022
  5165                                  		; es = 0F000h
  5166                                  		;mov	ax, 0F000h	; point	to ROM BIOS
  5167                                  		;mov	es, ax
  5168                                  
  5169                                  		; 19/10/2022
  5170 00001A1B 26813EEAFF434F          		cmp	word [es:0FFEAh], 'CO'
  5171                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEAh, 'OC' ; look for COMPAQ
  5172 00001A22 754B                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5173 00001A24 26813EECFF4D50          		cmp	word [es:0FFECh], 'MP'
  5174                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFECh, 'PM'
  5175 00001A2B 7542                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5176 00001A2D 26813EEEFF4151          		cmp	word [es:0FFEEh], 'AQ'
  5177                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEEh, 'QA'
  5178 00001A34 7539                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5179                                  
  5180                                  ; We're running on a COMPAQ. Now look at the date code.
  5181                                  
  5182 00001A36 26A1FBFF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFFBh]	; get year
  5183 00001A3A 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5184 00001A3C 3D3638                  		cmp	ax, 3836h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5185                                  		;cmp	ax, '86'        ; 3836h
  5186                                  					; is it	86?
  5187 00001A3F 772E                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch
  5188 00001A41 7218                    		jb	short do_compaq_patch
  5189 00001A43 26A1F5FF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFF5h]	; get month
  5190 00001A47 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5191 00001A49 3D3830                  		cmp	ax, 3038h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5192                                  		;cmp	ax, '08'        ; 3038h
  5193                                  					; is it	08?
  5194 00001A4C 7721                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch
  5195 00001A4E 720B                    		jb	short do_compaq_patch
  5196 00001A50 26A1F8FF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFF8h]	; get day

  5471                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5472                                  ;
  5473                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5474                                  
  5475                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5476                                  
  5477                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5478                                  ; module name: remap
  5479                                  ;
  5480                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5481                                  ;
  5482                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5483                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5484                                  ;
  5485                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5486                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5487                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5488                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5489                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5490                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5491                                  
  5492                                  ; input:       none
  5493                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5494                                  ; exit error:  none
  5495                                  ; called from: msinit
  5496                                  ;
  5497                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5498                                  ;	  found in the system
  5499                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5500                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5501                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5502                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5503                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5504                                  ;
  5505                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5506                                  
  5507                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5508                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5509                                  
  5510                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5511 00001AB1 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5512                                  
  5513                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5514                                  
  5515                                  drive_loop:				
  5516 00001AB6 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5517                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5518 00001ABA 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5519 00001ABC 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5520                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5521 00001ABE 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5522 00001AC1 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5523 00001AC3 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5524                                  
  5525                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5526                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5527                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5528                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5529                                  
  5530                                  fdrv_found:				
  5531 00001AC5 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5532                                  fdrv_loop:				
  5533 00001AC7 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5534 00001ACA 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5535                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5536                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5537                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5538 00001ACC 40                      		inc	ax
  5539 00001ACD 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ?
  5540 00001AD0 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk drives
  5541                                  
  5542                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5543                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  5544                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  5545                                  ; any more.
  5546                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5547                                  
  5548 00001AD2 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  5549                                  					; get first bds
  5550 00001AD7 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5551                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  5552 00001AD9 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  5553 00001ADE 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  5554                                  remap_loop1:				
  5555 00001AE1 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5556                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  5557 00001AE3 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5558 00001AE6 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  5559 00001AE8 FECC                    		dec	ah		; count down extra floppies
  5560 00001AEA 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  5561                                  
  5562                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  5563                                  
  5564 00001AEC 2EA0[8415]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  5565 00001AF0 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  5566 00001AF2 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  5567 00001AF4 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  5568 00001AF9 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  5569                                  
  5570                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  5571                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  5572                                  
  5573 00001AFB 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  5574 00001AFD EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  5575                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5576                                  
  5577                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  5578                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  5579                                  
  5580                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  5581 00001AFF 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  5582                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  5583 00001B04 2EA2[8415]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  5584 00001B08 FEC0                    		inc	al
  5585 00001B0A 1E                      		push	ds
  5586 00001B0B BF2D04                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  5587                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  5588 00001B0E 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  5589 00001B10 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  5590                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  5591                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  5592 00001B13 1F                      		pop	ds
  5593                                  rmap_exit:				
  5594 00001B14 C3                      		retn
  5595

  5597

  5599                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  5600                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  5601                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  5602                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  5603                                  ;**************************************************
  5604                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  5605                                  ;
  5606                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  5607                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  5608                                  ;
  5609                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  5610                                  ;**************************************************
  5611                                  
  5612                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5613                                  bootbias equ 200h
  5614                                  
  5615                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  5616                                  		
  5617                                  		; 08/04/2018
  5618                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  5619                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  5620                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5621                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  5622                                  
  5623 00001B15 2EA1[8715]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  5624 00001B19 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  5625                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5626 00001B1B BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  5627                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  5628                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  5629 00001B1E B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5630 00001B21 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  5631 00001B23 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  5632 00001B26 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5633                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5634                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5635                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5636 00001B28 7209                    		jb	short erret
  5637                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5638 00001B2A 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  5639                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  5640                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  5641 00001B31 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  5642                                  erret:					
  5643 00001B33 F9                      		stc
  5644                                  norm_ret:				
  5645 00001B34 C3                      		retn
  5646                                  
  5647                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5648                                  
  5649                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  5650                                  
  5651                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5652                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  5653                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  5654                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  5655                                  ;   determine version number
  5656                                  ;
  5657                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  5658                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  5659                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  5660                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  5661                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  5662                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  5663                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  5664                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5665                                  
  5666                                  sethard:	; proc near
  5667                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5668                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  5669 00001B35 57                      		push	di
  5670 00001B36 53                      		push	bx
  5671                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  5672 00001B37 06                      		push	es
  5673 00001B38 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5674 00001B3B 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5675 00001B3E 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  5676                                  					; fnon_removable
  5677 00001B42 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  5678                                  					; ffHardFile
  5679 00001B46 C606[8615]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  5680 00001B4B 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  5681 00001B4D 52                      		push	dx
  5682 00001B4E B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5683 00001B50 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5684                                  					; DL = drive number
  5685                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5686                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5687                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5688 00001B52 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  5689 00001B54 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  5690 00001B57 5A                      		pop	dx
  5691 00001B58 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  5692 00001B5A 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  5693 00001B5D 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  5694 00001B60 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  5695 00001B61 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  5696 00001B64 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  5697 00001B65 7256                    		jb	short setret
  5698 00001B67 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  5699                                  
  5700                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  5701                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  5702                                  
  5703                                  act_part:
  5704 00001B6A 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  5705 00001B6F 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  5706 00001B71 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  5707 00001B75 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  5708 00001B77 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  5709 00001B7B 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  5710 00001B7D 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  5711 00001B81 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  5712                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  5713 00001B83 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  5714                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  5715 00001B85 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  5716 00001B87 FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  5717                                  no_act:					
  5718 00001B89 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  5719 00001B8C 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  5720                                  					; last entry done?
  5721 00001B90 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  5722 00001B92 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  5723                                  					; restore original value of bx
  5724                                  
  5725                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  5726                                  
  5727                                  get_primary:
  5728 00001B95 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  5729 00001B9A 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  5730                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  5731 00001B9C 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  5732 00001BA0 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  5733 00001BA2 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  5734 00001BA6 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  5735 00001BA8 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  5736 00001BAC 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  5737                                  got_prim:
  5738 00001BAE 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  5739 00001BB0 740F                    		jz	short set2
  5740 00001BB2 FECE                    		dec	dh
  5741                                  not_prim:
  5742 00001BB4 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  5743 00001BB7 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  5744 00001BBB 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  5745                                  setret:					
  5746 00001BBD F9                      		stc			; error	return
  5747 00001BBE E99A02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  5748                                  
  5749                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5750                                  
  5751                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  5752                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  5753                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  5754                                  ;
  5755                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  5756                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  5757                                  ;  without change.
  5758                                  ;
  5759                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  5760                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  5761                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  5762                                  
  5763                                  set2:		
  5764                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5765                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  5766 00001BC1 8816[8915]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  5767                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  5768                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  5769 00001BC5 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  5770 00001BC9 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  5771                                  
  5772                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  5773                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  5774                                  
  5775 00001BCD 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  5776 00001BD0 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  5777 00001BD3 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  5778 00001BD7 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  5779 00001BDB 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  5780 00001BDD 800E[8615]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  5781                                  okdrive:
  5782 00001BE2 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  5783 00001BE6 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  5784                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  5785 00001BE9 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  5786 00001BED 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  5787 00001BF0 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  5788 00001BF4 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  5789 00001BF8 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  5790 00001BFB 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  5791                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  5792 00001BFE 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  5793 00001C01 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  5794 00001C03 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  5795 00001C06 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  5796                                  okdrive_1:
  5797 00001C08 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  5798 00001C0B 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  5799 00001C0E 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  5800                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  5801 00001C10 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  5802 00001C13 50                      		push	ax
  5803 00001C14 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  5804 00001C16 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  5805 00001C18 F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  5806                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  5807                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5808                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  5809                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  5810 00001C1A A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  5811 00001C1D 58                      		pop	ax
  5812 00001C1E F7F3                    		div	bx
  5813 00001C20 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  5814 00001C22 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  5815 00001C24 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  5816 00001C26 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  5817 00001C29 50                      		push	ax
  5818 00001C2A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  5819                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  5820 00001C2C A1[2105]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 12/08/2023
  5821 00001C2F F7F3                    		div	bx
  5822                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  5823 00001C31 A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 12/08/2023
  5824 00001C34 58                      		pop	ax
  5825 00001C35 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  5826                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  5827 00001C37 833E[2105]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  5828                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  5829 00001C3C 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  5830 00001C3E 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  5831 00001C41 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  5832                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  5833                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  5834                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  5835                                  okdrive_2:
  5836                                   		; 28/07/2019
  5837                                  ; dl is head.
  5838                                  ; ax is cylinder
  5839                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  5840                                  
  5841                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  5842                                  
  5843 00001C43 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  5844                                  					; check for mini disk
  5845 00001C47 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  5846 00001C49 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  5847                                  					; set the physical track number
  5848                                  oknotmini:
  5849                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  5850                                  				
  5851 00001C4C D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  5852 00001C4E D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  5853 00001C50 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  5854 00001C53 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  5855 00001C55 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch is cylinder (low 8 bits)
  5856                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  5857 00001C57 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is head
  5858                                  		
  5859                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  5860 00001C59 8A16[8915]              		mov	dl, [rom_drv_num]
  5861                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  5862                                  
  5863                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  5864                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  5865                                  ; dh is head
  5866                                  ; dl is drive
  5867                                  
  5868                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  5869                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  5870                                  
  5871                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  5872                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  5873                                  
  5874 00001C5D 0E                      		push	cs
  5875 00001C5E 07                      		pop	es
  5876 00001C5F BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  5877                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  5878                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  5879 00001C62 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5880 00001C65 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5881                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5882                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5883                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5884                                  
  5885                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  5886                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  5887                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  5888                                  
  5889                                  		; 11/08/2023
  5890                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  5891                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  5892 00001C67 53                      		push	bx
  5893 00001C68 50                      		push	ax
  5894                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5895                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  5896 00001C69 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  5897                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  5898 00001C6C 740B                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  5899 00001C6E 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  5900                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  5901 00001C71 7525                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  5902 00001C73 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  5903                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  5904 00001C77 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  5905                                  check_1_ok:
  5906                                  		; 11/08/2023
  5907 00001C79 BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB ; disksector+11
  5908                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  5909                                  					; point to the bpb in the boot record
  5910                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  5911 00001C7C 8A470A                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 12/08/2023 
  5912                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  5913 00001C7F 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  5914 00001C81 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  5915 00001C83 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  5916                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  5917 00001C85 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 12/08/2023
  5918 00001C89 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  5919                                  
  5920                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  5921 00001C8B 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 12/08/2023
  5922                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  5923                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  5924                                  					; a power of 2
  5925                                  					;
  5926                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  5927                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  5928 00001C8E 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it zero?
  5929 00001C90 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  5930                                  
  5931                                  ck_power_of_two:
  5932 00001C92 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift until first bit emerges
  5933 00001C94 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  5934 00001C96 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  5935                                  
  5936                                  invalid_boot_record:
  5937 00001C98 58                      		pop	ax
  5938 00001C99 5B                      		pop	bx
  5939 00001C9A E90901                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  5940                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  5941                                  
  5942                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5943                                  	; 12/08/2023
  5944                                  setret_brdg:
  5945 00001C9D E91DFF                  		jmp	setret
  5946                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5947                                  
  5948                                  unknown3_0_j:
  5949 00001CA0 E90701                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  5950                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  5951                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5952                                  
  5953                                  valid_boot_record:
  5954 00001CA3 58                      		pop	ax
  5955 00001CA4 5B                      		pop	bx
  5956                                  
  5957                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  5958                                  
  5959                                  		; 14/08/2023
  5960 00001CA5 817F08322E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '2.'
  5961                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5962                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E32h ; '2.'
  5963 00001CAA 7506                    		jnz	short try5
  5964 00001CAC 807F0A30                		cmp	byte [bx+10], '0'
  5965                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+0Ah], '0' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5966                                  		;;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 30h ; '0'
  5967                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5968                                  		;jnz	short try5
  5969                                  		;jmp	short copybpb
  5970 00001CB0 7425                    		jz	short copybpb
  5971                                  
  5972                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5973                                  ;	; 12/08/2023
  5974                                  ;setret_brdg:
  5975                                  ;		jmp	setret
  5976                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5977                                  ;
  5978                                  ;unknown3_0_j:
  5979                                  ;		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  5980                                  ;					; although, content might be bad.
  5981                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5982                                  
  5983                                  try5:
  5984 00001CB2 E8AA01                  		call	cover_fdisk_bug
  5985                                  
  5986                                  ; see if it is an os2 signature
  5987                                  
  5988                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5989                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment
  5990 00001CB5 817F08302E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '0.'
  5991                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '0.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5992                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E30h ; '0.'
  5993 00001CBA 750C                    		jnz	short no_os2
  5994 00001CBC 8A4707                  		mov	al, [bx+7] ; 12/08/2023
  5995                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+7]	; 17/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5996 00001CBF 2C31                    		sub	al, '1'
  5997                                  		;sub	al, 31h		; '1'
  5998 00001CC1 24FE                    		and	al, 0FEh
  5999 00001CC3 7412                    		jz	short copybpb	; accept either	'1' or '2'
  6000 00001CC5 E9DE00                  		jmp	unknown
  6001                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

  6401                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is guaranteed
  6402                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6403                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6404                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!

  6426 00001E01 B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  6427 00001E03 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)

  6433 00001E0F 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1

  6445                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)

  6447                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6448                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  6449                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32)
  6450                                  		;   TmpVal2 = TmpVal2 / 2;
  6451                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6452                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  6453                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {
  6454                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = 0;
  6455                                  		;   BPB_FATSz32 = FATSz;
  6456                                  		;} else {
  6457                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz);
  6458                                  		;/* there is no BPB_FATSz32 in a FAT16 BPB */
  6459                                  		;}

  6464 00001E22 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2-1
  6465                                  
  6466                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  6467

  6469                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
