  8631 0000034F A820                    		test	al, 20h		; test data set	ready
  8632 00000351 74F6                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8633 00000353 F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; flag_tranhol_emp - test transmit hold	reg empty
  8634 00000356 74F1                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8635                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8636                                  		; cf=0	; (test instruction resets cf)
  8637                                  		;clc
  8638 00000358 C3                      		retn
  8639                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8640                                  
  8641                                  ;************************************************************************
  8642                                  ;*									*
  8643                                  ;*	auxstat - call rom bios to determine aux port status		*
  8644                                  ;*									*
  8645                                  ;*	exit:	ax = status						*
  8646                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8647                                  ;*									*
  8648                                  ;************************************************************************
  8649                                  
  8650                                  auxstat:				
  8651 00000359 B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; auxfunc_status
  8652                                  
  8653                                  		; fall into auxop
  8654                                  
  8655                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8656                                  
  8657                                  ;************************************************************************
  8658                                  ;*									*
  8659                                  ;*	auxop - perform rom-biox aux port interrupt			*
  8660                                  ;*									*
  8661                                  ;*	entry:	ah = int 14h function number				*
  8662                                  ;*	exit:	ax = results						*
  8663                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8664                                  ;*									*
  8665                                  ;************************************************************************
  8666                                  
  8667                                  auxop:		; proc near		
  8668 0000035B 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  8669                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  8670                                  					; get port number
  8671 0000035F CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  8672                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  8673                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  8674 00000361 C3                      		retn
  8675                                  
  8676                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8677                                  
  8678                                  ;************************************************************************
  8679                                  ;*									*
  8680                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  8681                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  8682                                  ;*									*
  8683                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  8684                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  8685                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  8686                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  8687                                  ;*									*
  8688                                  ;************************************************************************
  8689                                  
  8690                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
  8691 00000362 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
  8692 00000365 C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
  8693                                  					; zero out buffer
  8694                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8695                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8696                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
  8697 00000368 C3                      		retn
  8698                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8699                                  
  8700                                  ;************************************************************************
  8701                                  ;*									*
  8702                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
  8703                                  ;*									*
  8704                                  ;************************************************************************
  8705                                  
  8706                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
  8707                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
  8708 00000369 E3AF                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  8709                                  aux_loop:				
  8710 0000036B 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
  8711                                  					; move di pointer to next character
  8712 0000036E 47                      		inc	di
  8713 0000036F B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
  8714 00000371 E8E7FF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
  8715 00000374 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
  8716 00000377 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
  8717 00000379 B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
  8718 0000037B E959FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
  8719                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8720                                  
  8721                                  awok:					
  8722 0000037E E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
  8723                                  					; still	more character to print
  8724                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8725                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8726                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
  8727 00000380 C3                      		retn
  8728                                  
  8729                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8730                                  
  8731                                  ;************************************************************************
  8732                                  ;*									*
  8733                                  ;*	getbx - return bx -> single byte input buffer for		*
  8734                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  8735                                  ;*									*
  8736                                  ;************************************************************************
  8737                                  
  8738                                  getbx:	
  8739 00000381 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  8740                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  8741                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  8742 00000385 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  8743                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8744                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  8745 00000389 C3                      		retn
  8746                                  
  8747                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8748                                  
  8749                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8750                                  
  8751                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8752                                  ;								:
  8753                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  8754                                  ;								:
  8755                                  ;								:
  8756                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  8757                                  ;								:
  8758                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  8759                                  ;								:
  8760                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  8761                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  8762                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  8763                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  8764                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  8765                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  8766                                  ;								:
  8767                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  8768                                  ;								:
  8769                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  8770                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  8771                                  ;								:
  8772                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8773                                  
  8774                                  ; convert time to ticks
  8775                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  8776                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  8777                                  
  8778                                  ;19/07/2019
  8779                                  ;09/03/2019
  8780                                  
  8781                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  8782                                  
  8783                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  8784                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  8785                                  
  8786 0000038A B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  8787 0000038C F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  8788 0000038E B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  8789 00000390 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  8790 00000392 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  8791 00000395 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  8792 00000397 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  8793 00000399 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  8794 0000039B B064                    		mov	al, 100
  8795 0000039D F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  8796 0000039F 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  8797 000003A1 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  8798 000003A4 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  8799 000003A6 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  8800 000003A8 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  8801                                  
  8802                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  8803                                  
  8804 000003AB 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  8805 000003AC 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  8806 000003AD BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  8807 000003B0 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  8808 000003B2 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  8809 000003B4 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  8810 000003B5 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  8811 000003B7 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  8812 000003B9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  8813 000003BC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  8814 000003BD BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  8815 000003C0 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  8816 000003C2 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  8817 000003C4 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  8818 000003C6 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  8819 000003C8 98                      		cbw
  8820 000003C9 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  8821 000003CA F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  8822 000003CC 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  8823 000003CE CB                      		retf			; far return
  8824                                  
  8825                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8826                                  
  8827                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8828                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8829                                  
  8830                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  8831                                  ;
  8832                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  8833                                  ;
  8834                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  8835                                  ;
  8836                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  8837                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  8838                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  8839                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  8840                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  8841                                  ;
  8842                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  8843                                  ;
  8844                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  8845                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  8846                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  8847                                  ;
  8848                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  8849                                  
  8850                                  	; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  8851                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:03EAh
  8852                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  8853 000003CF 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  8854 000003D2 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  8855                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  8856 000003D3 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  8857                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  8858 000003D8 7423                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  8859 000003DA 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  8860                                  					; get binary hours
  8861                                  					; convert to bcd
  8862                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  8863                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  8864                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8865 000003DE E8E800                  		call	bintobcd
  8866 000003E1 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  8867 000003E3 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  8868                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  8869                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  8870 000003E7 E8DF00                  		call	bintobcd
  8871 000003EA 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  8872 000003EC 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  8873                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  8874                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd
  8875 000003F0 E8D600                  		call	bintobcd
  8876                                  
  8877 000003F3 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  8878 000003F5 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  8879 000003F7 FA                      		cli
  8880 000003F8 B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  8881 000003FA CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8882                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  8883                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  8884                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  8885 000003FC FB                      		sti
  8886                                  no_cmos_1:				
  8887 000003FD 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  8888 00000401 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  8889                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8890 00000405 FF1E[C106]              		call	far [ttticks]
  8891                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  8892                                  					; convert time to ticks
  8893                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  8894 00000409 FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  8895 0000040A B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  8896 0000040C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  8897                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  8898                                  					; Return: time of day set
  8899                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  8900 0000040E 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  8901 00000412 FB                      		sti
  8902                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  8903 00000413 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  8904 00000418 7409                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  8905                                  
  8906                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8907                                  		;call	far [daycnttoday]
  8908                                  		;;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  8909                                  					; convert to bcd format
  8910 0000041A E80700                  		call	daycnttoday
  8911                                  
  8912 0000041D FA                      		cli
  8913 0000041E B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  8914 00000420 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8915                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  8916                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  8917                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  8918 00000422 FB                      		sti
  8919                                  no_cmos_2:
  8920                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8921                                  		; cf=0
  8922                                  		;clc
  8923 00000423 C3                      		retn
  8924                                  
  8925                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8926                                  
  8927                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  8928                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0440h
  8929                                  %if 1 
  8930                                  
  8931                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.
  8932                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
  8933                                  
  8934                                  daycnttoday:	; proc near
  8935                                  
  8936                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
  8937                                  ;
  8938                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
  8939                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
  8940                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
  8941                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
  8942                                  
  8943                                  		; 08/08/2023 (ds:) (near proc)
  8944                                  		; 16/10/2022 (cs:) (far proc)		
  8945 00000424 FF36[F004]              		push	word [daycnt] ; save daycnt
  8946 00000428 813E[F004]891C          		cmp	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
  8947                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
  8948 0000042E 7308                    		jnb	short century20
  8949                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 19
  8950                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 80
  8951                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8952 00000430 C706[F404]1350          		mov	word [base_century], 5013h
  8953 00000436 EB0C                    		jmp	short years
  8954                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8955                                  		
  8956                                  century20:				
  8957                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 20
  8958                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 0
  8959                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8960 00000438 C706[F404]1400          		mov	word [base_century], 20
  8961 0000043E 812E[F004]891C          		sub	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
  8962                                  					; adjust daycnt
  8963                                  years:					
  8964 00000444 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8965 00000446 A1[F004]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
  8966 00000449 BBB505                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
  8967                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
  8968 0000044C F7F3                    		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
  8969 0000044E 8916[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
  8970 00000452 B304                    		mov	bl, 4
  8971 00000454 F6E3                    		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
  8972 00000456 0006[F504]              		add	[base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
  8973 0000045A FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
  8974                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8975 0000045E BB6E01                  		mov	bx, 366
  8976 00000461 B90300                  		mov	cx, 3
  8977                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 366 ; daycnt=remainder of leap year
  8978 00000464 391E[F004]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 366
  8979 00000468 7619                    		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
  8980 0000046A FE06[F504]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
  8981                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 366 ; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
  8982 0000046E 291E[F004]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 366 ; 08/08/2023
  8983                                  		;mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
  8984                                  regularyear:	
  8985                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8986 00000472 4B                      		dec	bx ; 365			
  8987                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 365 ; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365; i++)
  8988 00000473 391E[F004]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
  8989 00000477 760F                    		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
  8990 00000479 FE06[F504]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; { daycnt -=	365
  8991                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 365 ; }
  8992 0000047D 291E[F004]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023 
  8993 00000481 E2EF                    		loop	regularyear	; }
  8994                                  					;
  8995                                  					; should never fall through loop
  8996                                  leapyear:	
  8997 00000483 C606[F704]1D            		mov	byte [february], 29 ; 08/08/2023			
  8998                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
  8999                                  					; change month table.
  9000                                  yeardone:				
  9001 00000488 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  9002 0000048A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  9003 0000048C A1[F004]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
  9004                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
  9005 0000048F BE[F604]                		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
  9006                                  		;mov	cx, 12
  9007                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9008 00000492 B10C                    		mov	cl, 12
  9009                                  months:					
  9010 00000494 FEC3                    		inc	bl
  9011                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9012 00000496 8A14                    		mov	dl, [si]	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:04B7h
  9013 00000498 39D0                    		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
  9014                                  					; dh=0
  9015 0000049A 7605                    		jbe	short month_done
  9016 0000049C 46                      		inc	si		; next month
  9017 0000049D 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt
  9018 0000049F E2F3                    		loop	months		;
  9019                                  					; should never fall through loop
  9020                                  month_done:	
  9021 000004A1 C606[F704]1C            		mov	byte [february], 28 ; 08/08/2023
  9022                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 28
  9023                                  					; restore month table value
  9024 000004A6 88DA                    		mov	dl, bl
  9025 000004A8 8A36[F504]              		mov	dh, [base_year]
  9026 000004AC 8A0E[F404]              		mov	cl, [base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
  9027 000004B0 E81600                  		call	bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
  9028                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
  9029 000004B3 86D0                    		xchg	dl, al
  9030 000004B5 E81100                  		call	bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
  9031 000004B8 86F0                    		xchg	dh, al
  9032 000004BA E80C00                  		call	bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
  9033 000004BD 86C8                    		xchg	cl, al
  9034 000004BF E80700                  		call	bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
  9035 000004C2 88C5                    		mov	ch, al
  9036 000004C4 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt] ; restore original value
  9037 000004C8 C3                      		retn
  9038                                  
  9039                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9040                                  
  9041                                  bintobcd:	; proc near		; real time clock support
  9042                                  
  9043                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
  9044                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
  9045                                  		
  9046 000004C9 D40A                    		aam			; AH = AL/10, AL = AL MOD 10
  9047 000004CB D510                    		aad     10h             ; db 0D5h,10h
  9048                                  					; AL = (AH*10H)+AL, AH = 0
  9049 000004CD C3                      		retn
  9050                                  %endif
  9051                                  
  9052                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9053                                  
  9054                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9055                                  
  9056                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9057                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9058                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9059                                  ;
  9060                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9061                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9062                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9063                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9064                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9065                                  ;
  9066                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9067                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9068                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9069                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9070                                  
  9071                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9072 000004CE E84B00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9073 000004D1 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9074                                  
  9075                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9076                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9077                                  ;
  9078                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9079                                  ;	       ----------------
  9080                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9081                                  ;
  9082                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9083                                  ;
  9084                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9085                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9086                                  ;		1,193,180
  9087                                  ;
  9088                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9089                                  ;
  9090                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9091                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9092                                  ;		59,659
  9093                                  ;
  9094                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9095                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9096                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9097                                  ;
  9098                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9099                                  ; multiply by 5
  9100                                  
  9101 000004D5 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9102 000004D7 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9103                                  					; multiply by 5
  9104 000004D9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9105 000004DB D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9106 000004DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9107 000004DF D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9108 000004E1 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9109 000004E3 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9110 000004E5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9111                                  
  9112                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9113                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9114                                  
  9115 000004E6 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9116 000004E9 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9117                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9118                                  
  9119                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9120                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9121 000004EB 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9122 000004EC 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9123 000004EE F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9124                                  
  9125                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9126                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9127                                  
  9128 000004F0 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9129 000004F2 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9130                                  
  9131                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9132                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9133                                  
  9134 000004F5 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9135 000004F7 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9136 000004FA 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9137 000004FC 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9138                                  noadj:					
  9139 000004FF F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9140 00000500 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9141                                  
  9142                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9143                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9144                                  
  9145 00000502 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9146 00000504 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9147 00000506 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9148 00000508 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9149 0000050B F7F1                    		div	cx
  9150 0000050D 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9151 0000050F F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9152 00000511 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9153                                  
  9154                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9155                                  
  9156                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9157                                  		;push	ax
  9158                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9159 00000513 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9160 00000514 AB                      		stosw
  9161                                  		;pop	ax
  9162 00000515 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9163 00000516 AB                      		stosw
  9164 00000517 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9165 00000519 AB                      		stosw
  9166 0000051A F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9167                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9168                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9169                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9170                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9171 0000051B C3                      		retn
  9172                                  
  9173                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9174                                  
  9175                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9176                                  
  9177                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9178                                  ;
  9179                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9180                                  ;
  9181                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9182                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9183                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9184                                  ;
  9185                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9186                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9187                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9188                                  ;			else
  9189                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9190                                  ;		}
  9191                                  ;
  9192                                  ; USES : AX
  9193                                  ;
  9194                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9195                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9196                                  ;
  9197                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9198                                  
  9199                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9200                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9201 0000051C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9202 0000051E CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9203                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9204                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9205                                  					; midnight
  9206                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9207 00000520 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9208 00000525 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9209 00000527 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9210                                  					; and not flag
  9211 00000529 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9212 0000052D C3                      		retn
  9213                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9214                                  
  9215                                  inc_case:				
  9216 0000052E 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9217 00000530 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9218 00000532 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9219                                  no_rollover:				
  9220 00000536 C3                      		retn
  9221

  9249                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9250                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9251                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9252                                  
  9253                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9254                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9255                                  
  9256                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9257                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9258                                  
  9259                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9260                                  
  9261                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9262                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9263                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9264                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9265                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9266                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9267                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9268                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9269                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9270                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9271                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9272                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9273                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9274                                  
  9275                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9276                                  
  9277                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9278                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9279                                  ;
  9280                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9281                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9282                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9283                                  ;   else
  9284                                  ;	set slow = value
  9285                                  ;   ...
  9286                                  ;*********************************************
  9287                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9288                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9289                                  ;*	 use slow
  9290                                  ;*   else
  9291                                  ;*	 use fast
  9292                                  ;*********************************************
  9293                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9294                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9295                                  ;	use slow
  9296                                  ;   else
  9297                                  ;	use fast
  9298                                  ;   ...
  9299                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9300                                  ;
  9301                                  ;
  9302                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9303                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9304                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9305                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9306                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9307                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9308                                  
  9309                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9310                                  
  9311                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9312                                  
  9313                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9314

  9316                                  ;	command jump table
  9317                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9318

  9320                                  ; 11/12/2022

  9339                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close

  9342                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9344                                  		dw 0C6Bh		; do_generic_ioctl
  9345                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9346                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9347                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9357 00000539 [5E17]                  		dw dsk_init

  9388                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9389                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9390                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9391                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]

  9393                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.

  9417                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed

  9502                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9503                                  
  9504                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9505                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9506                                  ; drive.
  9507                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9508                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9509                                  ; returns in si:
  9510                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9511                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9512                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9513                                  ;
  9514                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9515                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9516

  9522                                  					; get stored time
  9523 000005FD 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9524 000005FF 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9525 00000603 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9526                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9527                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
  9528                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]

  9530 00000607 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9531 00000609 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9532                                  		; 11/08/2023

  9534                                  		;cmp	al, 5

  9536                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5

  9539                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9540                                  		; 11/08/2023

  9542                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9543                                  		; 11/08/2023

  9687                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's

  9700                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
  9701                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)

  9728                                  
  9729                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9730                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9731                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9732                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9733                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9734                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9735                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9736                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9737                                  ;
  9738                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9739                                  ;
  9740                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9741                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9742                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9743                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9744                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9745                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9746                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9747                                  ;
  9748                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9749                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9750                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9751                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9752                                  
  9753                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9754                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9755 00000693 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
  9756 00000698 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
  9757 0000069A E99A00                  		jmp	getret_exit
  9758                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9759                                  
  9760                                  getbp1:					
  9761 0000069D 51                      		push	cx
  9762 0000069E 52                      		push	dx
  9763 0000069F 53                      		push	bx
  9764                                  
  9765                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
  9766                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
  9767                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
  9768                                  
  9769 000006A0 E8A900                  		call	readbootsec
  9770 000006A3 7209                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg ; carry set if there was error.
  9771 000006A5 09DB                    		or	bx, bx		; bx is	0 if boot sector is valid.
  9772 000006A7 7508                    		jnz	short dofatbpb
  9773 000006A9 E8EE00                  		call	movbpb		; move bpb into	registers
  9774 000006AC EB57                    		jmp	short Has1
  9775                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9776                                  
  9777                                  getbp_err_ret_brdg:

  9918                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9919                                  
  9920                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9921                                  
  9922                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9923                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9924                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9925                                  ;
  9926                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9927                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9928                                  
  9929                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9930                                  
  9931                                  readbootsec:	
  9932 0000074C B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9933 0000074E B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9934 00000751 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
  9935 00000754 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
  9936 00000756 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9937                                  
  9938                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9939                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9940                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9941                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9942                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9943                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9944                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9945                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9946                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9947                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9948                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9949                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9950                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9951                                  		; informations
  9952                                  
  9953                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9954                                  
  9955                                  		; 02/09/2023
  9956                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9957                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9958                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9959                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9960                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9961                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9962                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9963                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9964                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9965                                  
  9966                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
  9967 00000758 A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
  9968 0000075B 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
  9969 0000075D 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
  9970                                  					; don't need to find a nop
  9971 0000075F 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
  9972 00000761 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
  9973                                  					; no need for nop
  9974 00000763 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
  9975 00000765 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
  9976 00000767 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9977 0000076C 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
  9978                                  
  9979                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9980                                  ;
  9981                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9982                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9983                                  ;;
  9984                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9985                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9986                                  ;;
  9987                                  ;;check_signature:
  9988                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9989                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9990                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9991                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9992                                  
  9993                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9994                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9995                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9996                                  
  9997                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9998                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
  9999 0000076E A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10000                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10001 00000771 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10002 00000772 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10003 00000774 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10004 00000776 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10005 00000777 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10006                                  
 10007                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10008                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10009                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10010                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10011                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10012                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10013                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10014                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10015                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10016                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10017                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10018                                  
 10019                                  checksinglesided:
 10020                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10021                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10022                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10023 00000779 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10024 0000077B 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10025 0000077D A801                    		test	al, 1
 10026 0000077F 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10027 00000781 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10028 00000787 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10029 00000789 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10030 0000078E 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10031                                  
 10032                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10033                                  
 10034                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10035 00000790 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10036                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10037 00000795 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10038                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10039                                  
 10040                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10041 00000797 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10042                                  		; 10/12/2022

 10045 00000798 F8                      		clc
 10046                                  err_ret:
 10047 00000799 C3                      		retn

 10056                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10057                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10058                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10059                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10060                                  ;
 10061                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10062                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10063                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10064                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10065                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10066                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10067                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10068                                  
 10069                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10070                                  
 10071                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10072                                  movbpb:	
 10073 0000079A 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10074                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10075                                  					; sectors per unit
 10076 0000079E 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10077                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10078                                  					; number of directory entries
 10079 000007A2 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10080                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10081                                  					; size of drive
 10082 000007A6 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10083                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10084                                  					; media	descriptor
 10085 000007AA A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10086                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10087                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10088 000007AD 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10089                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10090                                  					; sectors per track
 10091 000007B1 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10092                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10093                                  					; number of heads
 10094 000007B5 803E[0205]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10095 000007BA 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10096 000007BC E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10097 000007BF 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10098 000007C1 C606[0205]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10099                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10100 000007C6 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10101 000007CB 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10102 000007CD E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10103                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10104                                  		; cf = 0
 10105                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10106                                  		;clc
 10107 000007D0 C3                      		retn
 10108                                  
 10109                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10110                                  
 10111                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10112                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10113                                  ;by es:di.
 10114                                  
 10115                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10116                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10117                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10118                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10119                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10120                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10121                                  
 10122                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10123                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10124 000007D1 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10125                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10126                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10127 000007D6 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10128 000007D8 51                      		push	cx
 10129 000007D9 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10130                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10131 000007DD 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10132 000007E1 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10133                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10134 000007E5 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10135 000007E9 57                      		push	di
 10136 000007EA 56                      		push	si
 10137 000007EB B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10138 000007EE BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10139                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10140                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10141 000007F1 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10142 000007F4 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10143                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10144                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10145 000007F6 B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10146 000007F8 BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10147                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10148 000007FB 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10149 000007FE F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10150 00000800 5E                      		pop	si
 10151 00000801 5F                      		pop	di
 10152 00000802 59                      		pop	cx
 10153                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10154                                  		; cf = 0
 10155                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10156                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10157 00000803 C3                      		retn

 10168                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10169                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10170                                  ; output:
 10171                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10172                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10173                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10174                                  
 10175                                  readfat:	
 10176                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10177                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10178 00000806 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10179 00000808 B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10180                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10181 0000080B E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10182 0000080E 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10183 00000810 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10184                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10185 00000812 C3                      		retn
 10186                                  
 10187                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10188                                  
 10189                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10190                                  
 10191                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10192                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10193                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10194                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10195                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10196                                  ;		dh has head
 10197                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10198                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10199                                  ;
 10200                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10201                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10202                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10203                                  ;
 10204                                  ;		carry set
 10205                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10206                                  ;
 10207                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10208                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10209                                  
 10210                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10211                                  
 10212                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10213                                  read_sector:	
 10214 00000813 55                      		push	bp
 10215 00000814 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10216 00000817 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10217 0000081B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10218                                  rd_ret:					
 10219 0000081E 06                      		push	es
 10220 0000081F 1E                      		push	ds
 10221 00000820 07                      		pop	es
 10222 00000821 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10223 00000824 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10224                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10225                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10226                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10227 00000826 07                      		pop	es
 10228 00000827 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10229                                  rd_rty:					
 10230 00000829 E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10231 0000082C 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10232 0000082E 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10233                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10234                                  					; fnon_removable
 10235 00000833 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10236 00000835 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10237 0000083A 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10238 0000083C 50                      		push	ax
 10239 0000083D 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10240 0000083E C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10241                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10242                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10243                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10244                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10245 00000842 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10246 00000844 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10247                                  		; 
 10248 00000847 1F                      		pop	ds
 10249 00000848 A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10250 0000084B 58                      		pop	ax
 10251                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10252 0000084C 06                      		push	es
 10253 0000084D 1E                      		push	ds
 10254 0000084E 07                      		pop	es
 10255 0000084F B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10256 00000852 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10257                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10258                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10259                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10260 00000854 07                      		pop	es
 10261 00000855 9C                      		pushf
 10262 00000856 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10263 0000085B 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10264 0000085D 50                      		push	ax
 10265 0000085E A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10266 00000861 1E                      		push	ds
 10267 00000862 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10268 00000866 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10269 00000869 1F                      		pop	ds
 10270 0000086A 58                      		pop	ax
 10271                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10272 0000086B 9D                      		popf
 10273 0000086C 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10274 0000086E EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10275                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10276                                  
 10277                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10278 00000870 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10279                                  					; return error
 10280 00000872 F9                      		stc
 10281                                  
 10282                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10283                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10284                                  
 10285                                  okret2:					
 10286 00000873 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10287 00000877 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10288 0000087B 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10289                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10290                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred
 10291 0000087F 9C                      		pushf
 10292 00000880 E8FD03                  		call	set_tim
 10293 00000883 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10294 00000884 5D                      		pop	bp
 10295 00000885 C3                      		retn

 10301                                  dsk_open:				; 2C7h:80Ah = 70h:2D7Ah
