 13802 000015AA E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13803 000015AD 5B                      		pop	bx
 13804                                  int13b:					
 13805 000015AE F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13806 000015AF EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13807                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13808                                  
 13809                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13810                                  
 13811                                  goterr13:				
 13812 000015B1 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13813 000015B4 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13814                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13815 000015B6 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13816 000015B9 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13817 000015BB 803E[3006]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13818 000015C0 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13819                                  
 13820 000015C2 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13821                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13822                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13823                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13824 000015C7 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13825                                  
 13826 000015C9 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13827                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13828                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13829 000015CB 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13830                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13831                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13832 000015D0 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13833 000015D3 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13834 000015D5 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13835 000015D7 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13836 000015D9 53                      		push	bx
 13837 000015DA 51                      		push	cx
 13838 000015DB 52                      		push	dx
 13839 000015DC A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13840                                  loop_ecc:				
 13841 000015DF B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13842                                  
 13843                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13844                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13845                                  ;
 13846                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13847                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13848                                  ; track.
 13849                                  ;
 13850                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13851                                  ; this request.
 13852                                  ;
 13853                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13854                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13855                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13856                                  ;
 13857 000015E2 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13858                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13859                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13860 000015E5 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13861                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13862 000015EA 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13863 000015EC 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13864 000015EF 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13865 000015F1 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13866 000015F4 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13867                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13868                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13869                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13870 000015F6 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13871                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13872                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13873                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13874                                  ok11_op:				
 13875 000015F8 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13876 000015FC 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13877 000015FE FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13878                                  					; add 200h to address
 13879 00001600 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13880 00001602 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13881 00001604 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13882                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13883                                  
 13884                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13885                                  
 13886                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13887 00001606 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13888                                  ok11_exit:				
 13889 00001607 5A                      		pop	dx
 13890 00001608 59                      		pop	cx
 13891 00001609 5B                      		pop	bx
 13892 0000160A EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13893                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13894                                  
 13895                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13896                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13897                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13898                                  
 13899                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13900 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 13901 0000160D 53                      		push	bx
 13902 0000160E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13903 00001611 1E                      		push	ds
 13904 00001612 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13905 00001613 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13906                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13907                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13908 00001616 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13909                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13910 0000161B 5B                      		pop	bx
 13911 0000161C 07                      		pop	es
 13912 0000161D 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13913 0000161F 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13914 00001622 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13915                                  
 13916                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13917                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13918                                  
 13919                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13920 00001624 56                      		push	si
 13921 00001625 57                      		push	di
 13922 00001626 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13923 00001628 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13924 0000162B E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 13925 0000162E 5F                      		pop	di
 13926 0000162F 5E                      		pop	si
 13927 00001630 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13928                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13929                                  
 13930                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13931                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13932                                  
 13933                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13934 00001632 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13935 00001635 FB                      		sti
 13936 00001636 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13937 00001639 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13938                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13939                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13940 0000163B 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13941 0000163E 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13942 00001640 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13943 00001643 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13944 00001645 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13945                                  
 13946                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13947                                  
 13948                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13949                                  
 13950 00001647 52                      		push	dx
 13951 00001648 51                      		push	cx
 13952 00001649 53                      		push	bx
 13953 0000164A 50                      		push	ax
 13954 0000164B 55                      		push	bp
 13955 0000164C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13956 0000164E 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13957 00001650 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13958 00001652 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13959 00001654 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13960 00001656 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13961 00001658 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13962 0000165A 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13963                                  
 13964                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13965                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13966                                  
 13967 0000165E 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13968 00001660 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13969                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13970                                  
 13971                                  no_skip_first:				
 13972 00001663 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13973 00001665 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13974 00001667 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13975                                  
 13976                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13977                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13978                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13979                                  ;
 13980                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13981                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13982                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13983                                  ; in error.
 13984                                  
 13985 00001669 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13986 0000166B 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13987                                  
 13988                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13989                                  
 13990 0000166D 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13991                                  					; set up head number
 13992 00001670 E888FE                  		call	doint
 13993 00001673 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13994                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13995                                  
 13996                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13997 00001676 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13998 00001678 F9                      		stc
 13999 00001679 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14000                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14001                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14002                                  
 14003                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14004                                  
 14005                                  intverify:				
 14006 0000167C 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14007 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 14008 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14009 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 14010                                  dosimple:				
 14011 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14012                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14013                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14014                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14015 00001683 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14016                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14017 00001688 5B                      		pop	bx
 14018 00001689 07                      		pop	es
 14019 0000168A E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14020                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14021                                  
 14022                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14023                                  
 14024                                  intformat:				
 14025 0000168D 06                      		push	es
 14026 0000168E 53                      		push	bx
 14027 0000168F 56                      		push	si
 14028 00001690 57                      		push	di
 14029 00001691 1E                      		push	ds
 14030                                  
 14031                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14032                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14033                                  
 14034 00001692 06                      		push	es
 14035 00001693 1E                      		push	ds
 14036 00001694 07                      		pop	es
 14037 00001695 1F                      		pop	ds
 14038 00001696 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14039 00001698 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14040 0000169B E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14041 0000169E 1F                      		pop	ds
 14042 0000169F 5F                      		pop	di
 14043 000016A0 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14044 000016A1 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14045                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14046                                  
 14047                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14048                                  ; the first block.
 14049                                  ;
 14050                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14051                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14052                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14053                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14054                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14055                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14056                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14057                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14058                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14059                                  
 14060                                  doblock:
 14061                                  
 14062                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14063                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14064                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14065                                  				
 14066 000016A3 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14067                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14068 000016A6 51                      		push	cx
 14069 000016A7 06                      		push	es
 14070 000016A8 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14071                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14072 000016A9 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14073 000016AC 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14074                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14075 000016B0 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14076                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14077 000016B5 5F                      		pop	di
 14078 000016B6 07                      		pop	es
 14079 000016B7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14080 000016B9 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14081 000016BB B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14082 000016BD 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14083                                  doblockflop:				
 14084 000016BF 59                      		pop	cx
 14085                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14086 000016C0 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14087 000016C2 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14088 000016C4 50                      		push	ax
 14089 000016C5 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14090 000016C7 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14091                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14092                                  
 14093                                  doblocklast:				
 14094 000016C9 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14095 000016CB 50                      		push	ax
 14096                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14097 000016CC E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14098 000016CF 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14099 000016D1 58                      		pop	ax
 14100 000016D2 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14101                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14102 000016D5 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14103 000016D7 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14104 000016D9 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14105 000016DB 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14106 000016DD 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14107                                  					; then we are done already.
 14108 000016DF 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14109                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14110 000016E1 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14111 000016E4 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14112                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14113                                  
 14114                                  bufferx:				
 14115 000016E6 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14116                                  					; set up head number
 14117                                  buffer:					
 14118 000016E9 53                      		push	bx
 14119 000016EA 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14120 000016ED 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14121 000016F0 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14122                                  					
 14123                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14124                                  
 14125 000016F2 06                      		push	es
 14126 000016F3 1E                      		push	ds
 14127 000016F4 56                      		push	si
 14128 000016F5 57                      		push	di
 14129 000016F6 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14130 000016F7 06                      		push	es
 14131 000016F8 1F                      		pop	ds
 14132 000016F9 07                      		pop	es
 14133 000016FA BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14134 000016FD 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14135 000016FE 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14136 00001700 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14137 00001703 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14138                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14139 00001704 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14140 00001705 5E                      		pop	si
 14141 00001706 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14142                                  
 14143                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14144                                  
 14145 00001707 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14146                                  					; get drive number
 14147 00001709 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14148 0000170C E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14149                                  					;
 14150                                  					; ah is	function
 14151                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14152                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14153                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14154                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14155                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14156 0000170F E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14157 00001712 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14158 00001713 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14159 00001715 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14160                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14161                                  
 14162                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14163                                  
 14164                                  doread:					
 14165 00001717 06                      		push	es
 14166 00001718 53                      		push	bx
 14167 00001719 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14168 0000171A 07                      		pop	es
 14169 0000171B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14170 0000171E B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14171 00001720 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14172                                  					; get drive number
 14173 00001723 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14174                                  					; ah = function
 14175                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14176                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14177                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14178 00001726 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14179 00001729 5B                      		pop	bx
 14180 0000172A 07                      		pop	es
 14181 0000172B 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14182 0000172D 56                      		push	si
 14183 0000172E 57                      		push	di
 14184 0000172F 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14185 00001731 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14186 00001734 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14187 00001737 5F                      		pop	di
 14188 00001738 5E                      		pop	si
 14189                                  
 14190                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14191                                  
 14192                                  dotail:					
 14193 00001739 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14194 0000173A 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14195 0000173D 41                      		inc	cx
 14196 0000173E 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14197 00001741 F8                      		clc
 14198 00001742 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14199 00001744 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14200                                  
 14201                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14202                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14203                                  
 14204 00001746 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14205 00001749 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14206 0000174C E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14207                                  
 14208                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14209                                  
 14210                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14211                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14212                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14213                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14214                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14215                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14216                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14217                                  
 14218                                  bad13:					
 14219 0000174F 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14220 00001751 5D                      		pop	bp
 14221 00001752 5B                      		pop	bx
 14222 00001753 5B                      		pop	bx
 14223 00001754 59                      		pop	cx
 14224 00001755 5A                      		pop	dx
 14225 00001756 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14226 00001758 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14227                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14228                                  
 14229                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14230 0000175B E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14231                                  
 14232                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14233                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14234                                  		;db 	0
 14235                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14236                                  
 14237                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14238

 14247                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14248 0000175E 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14249 00001762 BF[7F06]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14250 00001765 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14251 00001766 07                      		pop	es
 14252 00001767 E9E9EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14253                                  
 14254                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14255                                  
 14256                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14257                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14258                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14259                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14260                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14261                                  
 14262                                  install_bds:
 14263 0000176A 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14264 0000176B BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14265                                  
 14266                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14267                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14268                                  loop_next_bds:
 14269 0000176E C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14270                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14271 00001770 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14272 00001774 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14273                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14274 00001777 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14275 00001779 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14276 0000177B 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14277                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14278 0000177F 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14279 00001782 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14280                                  					; we don't own it
 14281 00001787 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14282                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14283 0000178A 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14284 0000178D 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14285                                  next_bds:
 14286                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14287 00001791 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14288 00001794 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14289                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14290                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14291 00001796 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14292 00001798 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14293                                  					; install bds
 14294 0000179B 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14295 0000179D 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14296                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14297                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14298 000017A0 1F                      		pop	ds
 14299                                  
 14300                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 14301                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)

 14303                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14304                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14305                                  
 14306                                  		; 01/06/2019
 14307                                  		;mov	al, [es:di+52]
 14308 000017A1 268A4534                		mov	al, [es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14309 000017A5 3A06[2C01]              		cmp	al, [eot]
 14310 000017A9 7603                    		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14311 000017AB A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot], al
 14312                                  _eot_ok:
 14313 000017AE C3                      		retn

 14320                                  ; 09/12/2022

 14327                                  ;  ask to swap the disk in drive a:

 14333                                  swpdsk:		
 14334 000017AF F606[6F08]01            		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14335                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14336 000017B4 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14337                                  		
 14338                                  		; set focus to the correct VM
 14339                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah
 14340                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14341 000017B6 9A[7008]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14342                                  		;call	far ptr	V86_Crit_SetFocus ; call far 70h:8D1h
 14343                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14344                                  no_win386:				
 14345 000017BB 51                      		push	cx
 14346 000017BC 52                      		push	dx
 14347 000017BD 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14348                                  					; get the drive	letter
 14349                                  
 14350                                  ; WARNING : next two instructions assume that if the new disk is for drive B
 14351                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa
 14352                                  
 14353 000017C1 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 14354 000017C3 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14355 000017C6 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14356 000017C8 B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 14357                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk
 14358                                  					; Broadcast it
 14359 000017CB CD2F                    		int	2Fh	
 14360 000017CD 41                      		inc	cx		; cx == -1 ?
 14361 000017CE 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 14362                                  
 14363                                  ; using a different drive in a one drive system so request the user change disks
 14364                                  
 14365 000017D0 80C241                  		add	dl, 'A'
 14366                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14367 000017D3 2E8816[0D18]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl
 14368                                  		; 16/10/2022
 14369                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:drvlet], dl
 14370                                  		;mov	byte ptr cs:17E4h, dl ; [cs:drvlet]
 14371                                  					; 0070h:3D54h =	2C7h:17E4h
 14372 000017D8 BE[F117]                		mov	si, SNGMSG
 14373                                  		;mov	si, 17C8h	; sngmsg
 14374                                  					; 0070h:3D38h =	2C7h:17C8h
 14375 000017DB 53                      		push	bx
 14376 000017DC 2E                      		cs
 14377 000017DD AC                      		lodsb			; get the next character of the message
 14378                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 14379                                  wrmsg_loop:				
 14380 000017DE CD29                    		int	29h		; DOS 2+ internal - FAST PUTCHAR
 14381                                  					; AL = character to display
 14382 000017E0 2E                      		cs

 14385                                  					; get the next character of the	message

 14392                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
 14393 000017ED 5B                      		pop	bx
