 15297                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15298                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 15299                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15300                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 30/12/2022))
 15301                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15302                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 15303                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15304                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 15305                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15306                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit6.s -l sysinit6.lst -o SYSINIT6.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 15307                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15308                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 15309                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15310                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 15311                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 15312                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15313                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 15314                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 15315                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15316                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 15317                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 15318                                  
 15319                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 15320                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 - 2019
 15321                                  ; SYSINIT (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) draft: 'sysinit3.s' (01/07/2019)
 15322                                   
 15323                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15324                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15325                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 15326                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 15327                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 15328                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15329                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15330                                  
 15331                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15332                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15333                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15334                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15335                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15336                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15337                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15338                                  ;
 15339                                  ;
 15340                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15341                                  ;
 15342                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15343                                  ;
 15344                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15345                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15346                                  ;
 15347                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15348                                  ;
 15349                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15350                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15351                                  ;
 15352                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15353                                  ;
 15354                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15355                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15356                                  ;value.
 15357                                  ;
 15358                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15359                                  ;
 15360                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15361                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15362                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15363                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15364                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15365                                  ;
 15366                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15367                                  ;
 15368                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15369                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15370                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15371                                  ;
 15372                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15373                                  ;
 15374                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15375                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15376                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15377                                  ;
 15378                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15379                                  ;
 15380                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15381                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15382                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15383                                  ;
 15384                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15385                                  ;
 15386                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15387                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15388                                  ;
 15389                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15390                                  ;
 15391                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15392                                  ;
 15393                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15394                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15395                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15396                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15397                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15398                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15399                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15400                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15401                                  ;memory.
 15402                                  ;NOTES:
 15403                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15404                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15405                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15406                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15407                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15408                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15409                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15410                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15411                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15412                                  
 15413                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15414                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15415                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15416                                  
 15417                                  ;include version.inc
 15418                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15419                                  
 15420                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15421                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15422                                  
 15423                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15424                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15425                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15426                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15427                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15428                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15429                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15430                                  
 15431                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15432                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15433                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15434                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15435                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15436                                  
 15437                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15438                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15439                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15440                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15441                                  
 15442                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 15443                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 15444                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 15445                                  
 15446                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15447                                  
 15448                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15449                                  				; currently 0.
 15450                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15451                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15452                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15453                                  
 15454                                  ;      if1
 15455                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15456                                  ;      endif
 15457                                  
 15458                                         ;******************************
 15459                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15460                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15461                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15462                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15463                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15464                                         ;******************************
 15465                                  
 15466                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15467                                  ; device definitions
 15468                                  
 15469                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15470                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15471                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15472                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15473                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15474                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 15475                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 15476                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 15477                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 15478                                  
 15479                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 15480                                  struc	SYSDEV
 15481 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 15482 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 15483 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 15484 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 15485 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 15486                                  .size:
 15487                                  endstruc
 15488                                  
 15489                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 15490                                  struc	SRHEAD
 15491 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 15492 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 15493 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 15494 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 15495 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 15496                                  .size:
 15497                                  endstruc
 15498                                  
 15499                                  ;Status word masks
 15500                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 15501                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 15502                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 15503                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 15504                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 15505                                  
 15506                                  ;Function codes
 15507                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 15508                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 15509                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 15510                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 15511                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 15512                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 15513                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 15514                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 15515                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 15516                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 15517                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 15518                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 15519                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 15520                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 15521                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 15522                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 15523                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 15524                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 15525                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 15526                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 15527                                  
 15528                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15529                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15530 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15531 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15532 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15533 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15534 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15535 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15536                                                          ; word
 15537 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15538 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15539 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15540 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15541                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15542                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15543                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15544                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15545                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15546                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15547                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15548                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15549 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15550 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15551 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15552 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15553 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15554 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15555                                  .size:
 15556                                  endstruc
 15557                                  
 15558                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15559                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15560                                  
 15561                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15562                                  
 15563                                  struc buffinfo
 15564 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15565 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15566 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15567                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15568                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15569 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15570                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15571                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15572                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15573                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15574                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15575                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15576                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15577                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15578 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15579                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15580 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15581 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15582 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15583 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15584 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15585                                  .size:
 15586                                  endstruc
 15587                                  
 15588                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15589                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15590                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15591                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15592                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15593                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15594                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15595                                  
 15596                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15597                                  
 15598                                  
 15599                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15600                                  
 15601                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15602                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15603                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15604                                  ;***
 15605                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15606                                  ;***
 15607                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15608                                  
 15609                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15610                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15611                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15612                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15613                                  
 15614                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 15616                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15617                                  
 15618                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15619                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15620                                  
 15621                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15622                                  
 15623                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15624                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15625                                  ;
 15626                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15627                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15628                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15629                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15630                                  ;
 15631                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15632                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15633                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15634                                  
 15635                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15636                                  
 15637                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15638                                  
 15639                                  struc	DPB
 15640 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15641 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15642 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15643 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15644 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15645 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15646 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15647 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15648 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15649 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15650                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15651 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15652 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15653 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15654 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15655 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15656                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15657 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15658 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15659 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15660                                  .size:
 15661                                  endstruc
 15662                                  
 15663                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15664                                  
 15665                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 15666

 15722                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15723                                  
 15724                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15725                                  ;
 15726                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15727                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15728                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15729                                  ;
 15730                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15731                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15732                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15733                                  ;
 15734                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15735                                  
 15736                                  struc A_BPB
 15737 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15738 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15739 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15740 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15741 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15742 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15743 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15744 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15745 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15746 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15747 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15748 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15749 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15750 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15751 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15752                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15753                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15754                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15755                                  .size:
 15756                                  endstruc
 15757                                  
 15758                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 15759 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 15760 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15761 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15762 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15763 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15764 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 15765 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 15766 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 15767                                  endstruc

 16017                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16018                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16019                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16020                                  									  
 16021                                  ;*******************************					  
 16022                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16023                                  ;*******************************					  
 16024                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16025                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16026                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16027                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16028                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16029                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16030                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16031                                  ;For all others:							  
 16032                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16033                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16034                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16035                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16036                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16037                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16038                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16039                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16040                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16041                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16042                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16043                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16044                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16045                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16046                                  ;									  
 16047                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16048                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16049                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16050                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16051                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16052                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16053                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16054                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16055                                  ;									  
 16056                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16057                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16058                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16059                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16060                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16061                                  ;									  
 16062                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16063                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16064                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16065                                  ;									  
 16066                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16067                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16068                                  ;									  
 16069                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16070                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16071                                  ;									  
 16072                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16073                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16074                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16075                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16076                                  ;						called. 		  
 16077                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16078                                  ;									  
 16079                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16080                                  ;									  
 16081                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16082                                  ;									  
 16083                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16084                                  ;									  
 16085                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16086                                  ;									  
 16087                                  
 16088                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16089                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16090 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16091 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16092                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16093 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16094 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16095 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16096 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 16097                                  endstruc					  
 16098

 16101                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b

 16206                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16207                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16208                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16209                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16210                                  
 16211                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16212                                  ;
 16213                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16214                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16215                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16216                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16217                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16218                                  ;
 16219                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16220                                  ;
 16221                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16222                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16223                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16224                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16225                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16226                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16227                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16228                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16229                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16230                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16231                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16232                                  
 16233                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16234                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16235                                  
 16236                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16237                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16238 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16239 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16240 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16241 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16242 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16243 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16244                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16245 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16246 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16247 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16248                                  .size:
 16249                                  endstruc
 16250                                  
 16251                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16252                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16253                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16254                                  						; argument
 16255                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 16256

 16258

 16260                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16261                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16262                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 16263                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 16264                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 16266                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16267                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16268                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16269                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16270                                  
 16271                                  ; system file table
 16272                                  
 16273                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16274                                  ;
 16275                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16276                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16277                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16278                                  
 16279                                  struc	SF
 16280 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16281 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16282 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16283                                  .size:
 16284                                  endstruc
 16285                                  
 16286                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16287                                  ;
 16288                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16289                                  
 16290                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16291 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16292                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16293 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16294 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16295 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16296                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16297                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16298                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16299                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16300                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16301                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16302                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16303                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16304                                  					;
 16305                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16306                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16307                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16308                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16309                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16310                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16311                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16312                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16313                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16314                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16315                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16316                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16317 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16318                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16319                                  					; points to net device header if
 16320                                  					; remote
 16321 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16322                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16323 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16324 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16325 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16326 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16327                                  ;
 16328                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16329                                  ; ID
 16330                                  ;
 16331 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16332 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16333 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 16334                                  ;
 16335                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 16336                                  ;
 16337 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 16338                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 16339                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 16340                                  					; disk changed errors.
 16341                                  ; SHARING INFO
 16342 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 16343 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 16344 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 16345 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 16346 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 16347 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 16348                                  .size:
 16349                                  endstruc

 16621                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 16622                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 16628                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16629                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16630                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16631                                  
 16632                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16633                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16634                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16635                                  
 16636                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16637                                  ;
 16638                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16639                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16640                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16641                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16642                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16643                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16644                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16645                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16646                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16647                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16648                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16649                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16650                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16651                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16652                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16653                                  ;
 16654                                  
 16655                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16656                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16657                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16658                                  ;
 16659                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16660                                  ;
 16661                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16662                                  ;
 16663                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16664                                  ;
 16665                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16666                                  ;
 16667                                  
 16668                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16669                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16670                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16671                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16672                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16673                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16674                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16675                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16676                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16677                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16678                                  
 16679                                  		;EVEN
 16680                                  ;align 2
 16681                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16682                                  
 16683 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16684 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16685 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16686 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16687 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16688 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16689                                  
 16690 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16691 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16692 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16693                                  
 16694                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16695                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16696                                  
 16697                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16698                                  
 16699 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16700                                  
 16701                                  int02:
 16702                                  
 16703                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16704                                  ;
 16705                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16706                                  ;
 16707                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16708                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16709                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16710                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16711                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16712                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16713                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16714                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16715                                  ;
 16716                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16717                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16718                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16719                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16720                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16721                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16722                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16723                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16724                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16725                                  ;
 16726                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16727                                  
 16728 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16729 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16730 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16731 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16732                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16733 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16734 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16735 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16736                                  
 16737 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16738                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16739                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16740                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16741                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16742 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16743 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16744                                  special02:
 16745 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 16746 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 16747                                  normal02:
 16748 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 16749 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16750 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 16978                                  ;********************************************************************
 16979                                  ;common routines
 16980                                  ;********************************************************************
 16981                                  
 16982                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16983                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16984                                  ; service routine
 16985                                  
 16986                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16987                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16988                                  
 16989                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16990                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16991                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16992                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16993                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16994                                  
 16995                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 16996                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 16997                                  
 16998                                  do_int_stacks:
 16999 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17000 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17001 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17002 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17003 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 17004 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 17005                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17006                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 17007                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17008 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 17009 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 17010 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 17011                                  
 17012 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 17013                                  found02:
 17014 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 17015 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 17016                                  
 17017 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 17018                                  
 17019 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 17020                                  	; 21/10/2022

 18443                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18444                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18445                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18446                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18447                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18448                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18449                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18450                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18451                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18452                                  ;
 18453                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18454                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18455                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18456                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18457                                  ; been patched.

 18772                                  
 18773                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 18774                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 18775                                  ;   which follow....)
 18776                                  
 18777                                  retry:
 18778 00000779 BA[AB45]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18779                                  
 18780                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18781                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18782                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18783                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18784                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18785                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18786                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18787                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18788                                  
 18789                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18790                                  
 18791 0000077C 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18792 0000077D BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 18793 00000780 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18794 00000782 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 18795 00000784 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18796 00000786 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 18797 00000788 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 18798                                  
 18799 0000078A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18800 0000078C B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 18801 0000078E CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 18802 00000790 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18803                                  
 18804                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18805                                  
 18806                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18807                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18808                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18809                                  
 18810                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18811                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 18812 00000792 8B1E[9402]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 18813 00000796 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18814                                  
 18815                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18816                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18817                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18818                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18819                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18820                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18821                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18822                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18823                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18824                                  ;
 18825                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18826                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18827                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18828                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18829                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18830                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18831                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18832                                  
 18833                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 18834                                  	; (SYSINIT:0858h)
 18835 00000798 8B0E[B414]              	mov	cx,[config_envlen]
 18836 0000079C E303                            jcxz	no_env		; use config_wrkseg only if there's env data
 18837 0000079E A1[B614]                        mov	ax,[config_wrkseg]	
 18838                                  
 18839                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18840                                  	;mov	cx,[config_envlen]
 18841                                          ;jcxz	no_env		; use config_wrkseg only if there's env data
 18842                                          ;mov	ax,[config_wrkseg]
 18843                                  ;no_env:
 18844                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18845                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0841h)
 18846                                  no_env:
 18847                                  	; 30/12/2022
 18848                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0861h)
 18849 000007A1 29C3                      	sub     bx,ax           ; bx is size of sysinit in para

 19290                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19291                                  ;
 19292                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19293                                  ;
 19294                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19295                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19296                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19297                                  ;

 19673                                  
 19674                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19675                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19676                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19677                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19678                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19679                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19680                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19681                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19682                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19683                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19684                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19685                                  ;
 19686                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19687                                  
 19688                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19689                                  update_arena:
 19690 00000A10 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19691 00000A11 57                      	push	di
 19692 00000A12 51                      	push	cx
 19693 00000A13 52                      	push	dx
 19694                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19695                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19696                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19697                                  	; ds = cs 
 19698 00000A14 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19699 00000A18 4F                      	dec	di
 19700 00000A19 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19701                                  						;  before sysvar
 19702 00000A1A 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19703                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19704 00000A1C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19705 00000A21 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19706 00000A23 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19707                                  
 19708                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19709 00000A25 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19710 00000A2A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19711 00000A2C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19712 00000A2E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19713 00000A30 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19714                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19715 00000A32 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19716                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19717 00000A36 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19718 00000A3C 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19719                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19720 00000A3E 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19721 00000A42 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19722                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19723                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19724 00000A44 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19725 00000A47 5A                      	pop	dx
 19726 00000A48 59                      	pop	cx
 19727 00000A49 5F                      	pop	di
 19728 00000A4A 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19729 00000A4B C3                      	retn
 19730                                  ;
 19731                                  ; M012 : END
 19732                                  ;

 19750                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19751                                  ;
 19752                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19753                                  ;
 19754                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19755                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19756                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19757                                  ;
 19758                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19759                                  ;
 19760                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19761                                  
 19762                                  AllocHMA:
 19763                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19764                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19765                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19766                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19767                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19768                                  
 19769                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19770                                  ;
 19771                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19772                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19773                                  ;	push	ax
 19774                                  ;	popf
 19775                                  ;	pushf
 19776                                  ;	pop	ax
 19777                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19778                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19779                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19780                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19781                                  
 19782                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19783                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19784                                  
 19785 00000A58 1E                      	push	ds
 19786                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19787                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19788                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19789 00000A59 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19790 00000A5C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19791                                  
 19792 00000A5E E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19793 00000A61 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19794                                  
 19795 00000A63 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19796 00000A66 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19797                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19798                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19799                                  
 19800 00000A68 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19801                                  	;mov	[0Eh],bx
 19802 00000A6C 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19803                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19804                                  
 19805 00000A70 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19806 00000A72 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19807                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19808 00000A75 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19809 00000A79 48                      	dec	ax
 19810 00000A7A 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19811                                  
 19812                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19813                                  
 19814 00000A7C B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19815 00000A7E CD15                    	int	15h
 19816                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19817                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19818                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19819 00000A80 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19820                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19821                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19822 00000A83 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19823                                  allocHMA_1:
 19824 00000A85 B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19825                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19826 00000A87 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
