 19920                                  
 19921                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19922                                  ;
 19923                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19924                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19925                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19926                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19927                                  ;
 19928                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19929                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19930                                  ;
 19931                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19932                                  
 19933                                  StartVDHead:
 19934                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19935                                  
 19936 00000AD0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19937 00000AD4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19938 00000AD6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19939 00000AD8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19940 00000ADA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19941                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19942 00000ADB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19943                                  VDiskSig1:
 19944 00000AE2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19945                                  
 19946                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19947                                  
 19948 00000AE7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19949                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19950 00000AED 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19951 00000AFC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19952 00000AFE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19953                                  VDInt19:
 19954 00000AFF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19955                                  OldVDInt19:
 19956 00000B00 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19957                                  
 19958                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19959                                  
 19960                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19961 00000B04 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19962                                  VDiskSig2:
 19963 00000B07 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19964                                  
 19965                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19966                                  
 19967 00000B0C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19968 00000B0F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19969 00000B11 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19970 00000B12 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19971 00000B14 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19972 00000B15 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19973 00000B17 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19974 00000B19 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19975 00000B1A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19976 00000B1C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19977 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19978 00000B20 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19979 00000B22 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19980                                  
 19981                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19982                                  
 19983                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19984                                  ;
 19985                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19986                                  ;
 19987                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19988                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19989                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19990                                  ;
 19991                                  ; Inputs : None
 19992                                  ;
 19993                                  ; Outputs : None
 19994                                  ;
 19995                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19996                                  ;
 19997                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19998                                  
 19999                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20000                                  
 20001                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20002 00000B24 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20003 00000B26 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20004                                  
 20005                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20006                                  
 20007                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20008 00000B28 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20009                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20010 00000B2B 2EA3[000B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20011 00000B2F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20012                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20013 00000B32 2EA3[020B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20014                                  
 20015                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20016                                  
 20017 00000B36 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20018                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20019                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20020 00000B38 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20021 00000B3B CD21                    	int	21h
 20022                                  
 20023                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20024                                  
 20025 00000B3D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20026 00000B3E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20027                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20028 00000B40 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20029                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20030 00000B47 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20031 00000B4E 40                      	inc	ax
 20032 00000B4F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20033                                  
 20034                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20035                                  
 20036 00000B51 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20037                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20038 00000B52 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20039 00000B58 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20040                                  
 20041                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20042                                  
 20043                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20044 00000B5B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20045 00000B5E BE[D00A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20046 00000B61 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20047 00000B63 0E                      	push	cs
 20048 00000B64 1F                      	pop	ds
 20049 00000B65 FC                      	cld
 20050 00000B66 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20051 00000B68 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20052                                  
 20053                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20054                                  
 20055                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20056 00000B69 57                      	push	di
 20057 00000B6A 06                      	push	es
 20058                                  
 20059                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20060                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20061                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20062 00000B6B 49                      	dec	cx
 20063                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20064 00000B6C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20065                                  
 20066 00000B6E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20067                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20068 00000B71 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20069 00000B74 BE[040B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20070 00000B77 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20071                                  
 20072 00000B79 5F                      	pop	di
 20073 00000B7A 07                      	pop	es
 20074                                  
 20075 00000B7B C3                      	retn
 20076                                  
 20077                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20078                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 20079                                  ;
 20080                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 20081                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 20082                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 20083                                  ;
 20084                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20085                                  
 20086                                  struc desc
 20087 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 20088 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 20089 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 20090 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 20091 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 20092                                   .size:

 20094                                  
 20095                                  		; 23/10/2022

 20097

 20099 00000B7C 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0		 
 20100                                  gdt:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 20101 00000B84 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20102 00000B8C FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 20103 00000B8E 0000                    		dw	0
 20104 00000B90 00                      		db	0
 20105 00000B91 93                      		db	93h
 20106 00000B92 0000                    		dw	0

 20108 00000B96 0000                    		dw	0

 20110 00000B99 93                      		db	93h
 20111 00000B9A 0000                    		dw	0

 20116 00000BA4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20117                                  
 20118 00000BAC 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 20119                                  
 20120                                  
 20121                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20122                                  
 20123                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20124                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20125                                  
 20126                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20127                                  
 20128                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20129                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20130                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	     ;I070
 20131                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	     ;I070
 20132                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	     ;I070
 20133                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	     ;I070
 20134                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	     ;I070
 20135                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	     ;I070
 20136                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			     ;I070
 20137                                  ;								     ;I070
 20138                                  ;	in      al,64h         		; Test for passwd servr mode ;I070
 20139                                  ;	test    al,10h			; Is keyboard inhibited?     ;I070
 20140                                  ;	jnz     short ClrVDISKok	; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20141                                  ;					; Check for Tortugas...	     ;I070
 20142                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                	     ;I070
 20143                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h  ; ds = cs       
 20144                                  ;	mov	ax,[sys_model_byte]
 20145                                  ;	cmp	ax,19F8h
 20146                                  ;	je      short ClrVDISKno                            	     ;I070
 20147                                  ;					; Check for mod 30-286	     ;I070
 20148                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh			     ;I070
 20149                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],09FCh	
 20150                                  ;	cmp	ax,09FCh
 20151                                  ;	jne     short ClrVDISKok			      	     ;I070
 20152                                  ;ClrVDISKno:							     ;I070	
 20153                                  ;	retn	               		; Return w/o block move.     ;I070
 20154                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							     ;I070
 20155                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20156                                  
 20157                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20158                                  	; ds = cs
 20159                                  
 20160                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20161                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20162                                  
 20163 00000BCC 06                      	push	es
 20164 00000BCD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20165 00000BCF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20166 00000BD1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20167 00000BD3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20168 00000BD5 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20169 00000BD7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20170 00000BD9 05[AC0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20171 00000BDC 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20172                                  
 20173                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20174                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20175                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20176                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20177                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 20178                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20179                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20180 00000BDF A3[8E0B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 20181                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20182 00000BE2 8816[900B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20183                                  
 20184 00000BE6 B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 20185 00000BE9 0E                      	push	cs
 20186 00000BEA 07                      	pop	es
 20187 00000BEB BE[7C0B]                	mov	si,bmove
 20188 00000BEE B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 20189 00000BF0 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 20190                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 20191                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 20192                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status

 20197                                  ;
 20198                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20199                                  ;
 20200                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20201                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20202                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20203                                  ;		the offset.
 20204                                  ;
 20205                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20206                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20207                                  ;
 20208                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20209                                  
 20210                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 20211                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20212 00000BF4 1E                      	push	ds
 20213 00000BF5 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20214 00000BF8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20215                                  	;
 20216 00000BFA 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20217 00000BFC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 20218                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20219 00000BFF A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 20220                                  	;
 20221 00000C02 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20222 00000C04 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20223 00000C07 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20224 00000C0A B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20225 00000C0C D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20226 00000C0E 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20227                                  	;
 20228                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20229                                  	;push	ds
 20230                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20231                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20232                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20233                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20234                                  	;mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20235                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 20236 00000C10 893E[9508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20237                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20238 00000C14 1F                      	pop	ds
 20239 00000C15 C3                      	retn

 20243                                  ; procedure : IsVDiskInstalled
 20244                                  ;
 20245                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary

 20249                                  ; Outputs : Zero set if VDISK header found else Zero cleared

 20260                                  	;mov	cx,VLEN1 ; 5

 20265 00000C29 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 20266 00000C2B 740F                    	je	short ivdins_retn
 20267 00000C2D B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20268 00000C30 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20269                                  	;mov	si,10h+(VDiskSig2-VDiskHMAHead) ; 13h
 20270 00000C32 BE1300                  	mov	si,13h

 20280                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20281                                  ;
 20282                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20283                                  ;
 20284                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20285                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20286                                  ;
 20287                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20288                                  
 20289                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20290                                  CPMHack:
 20291 00000C3D 1E                      	push	ds
 20292 00000C3E B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20293 00000C41 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = 0FFFFh
 20294                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20295                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20296 00000C43 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20297 00000C44 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20298 00000C46 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20299 00000C49 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20300                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20301 00000C4C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20302 00000C4E FC                      	cld
 20303 00000C4F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20304 00000C51 1F                      	pop	ds
 20305 00000C52 C3                      	retn

 20320                                  ;**	TempCDS - Create (Temporary?) CDS
 20321                                  ;

 21206                                  
 21207                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21208                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21209                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21210                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21211                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21212                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21213                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21214                                  ;
 21215                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21216                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21217                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21218                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21219                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21220                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21221                                  ;
 21222                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21223                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21224                                  ;
 21225                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21226                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21227                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21228                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21229                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21230                                  ;
 21231                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21232                                  ;
 21233                                  ;			  none.
 21234                                  
 21235                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21236                                  ;
 21237                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21238                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21239                                  
 21240                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21241

 21447                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21448                                  ;
 21449                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21450                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21451                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21452                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21453                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21454                                  ; program).

 21459

 21469                                  ; carridge return.

 21616                                  
 21617                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21618                                  ;
 21619                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21620                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21621                                  ;
 21622                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21623                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21624                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21625                                  
 21626                                  ParaRound:
 21627 0000114B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21628 0000114E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21629 00001150 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21630 00001152 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21631 00001154 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21632 00001156 C3                      	retn
 21633                                  
 21634                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21635                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21636                                  ;
 21637                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21638                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21639                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21640                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21641                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21642                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21643                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21644                                  ;
 21645                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21646                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21647                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21648                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21649                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21650                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21651                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset value of end of sysinit module label
 21652                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21653                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21654                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21655                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21656                                  ;
 21657                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21658                                  
 21659                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21660                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21661                                  sysinit_base:				
 21662 00001157 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21663 0000115C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21664 00001161 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21665 00001163 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21666 00001168 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21667 0000116D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21668 0000116E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21669 0000116F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21670                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21671                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21672 00001171 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21673 00001174 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21674 00001179 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21675                                  
 21676                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21677                                  
 21678 0000117B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21679 0000117D 0E                      	push	cs
 21680 0000117E 1F                      	pop	ds
 21681                                  	; 30/12/2022
 21682                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 21683                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 21684 0000117F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21685                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21686 00001182 CD21                    	int	21h
 21687                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21688                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21689                                  
 21690                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21691                                  stall:
 21692                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21693                                  _stall: 
 21694                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21695 00001184 F4                      	hlt 
 21696                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21697                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21698 00001185 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21699                                  
 21700                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21701 00001187 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21702                                  
 21703                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21704                                  
 21705                                  sum_up:
 21706                                  
 21707                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21708                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21709                                  ;
 21710                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21711                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21712                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21713                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21714                                  ;
 21715                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21716                                  
 21717 0000118C 1E                      	push	ds
 21718                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21719                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 21720 0000118D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21721                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21722                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21723 00001191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21724 00001193 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21725 00001195 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21726 00001197 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21727                                  					; whole test better fail.
 21728 0000119C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21729 0000119E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21730                                  sum1:
 21731 000011A0 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21732 000011A2 46                      	inc	si
 21733 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 21734 000011A4 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21735                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21736                                  sum_sys_code:
 21737                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21738 000011A6 BEA611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21739                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21740                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21741                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21742                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21743                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21744                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21745                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 21746 000011A9 B9[704D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21747 000011AC 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21748 000011AE D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21749                                  sum2:
 21750 000011B0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21751 000011B3 46                      	inc	si
 21752 000011B4 46                      	inc	si
 21753 000011B5 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21754 000011B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 21755 000011B8 C3                      	retn
 21756                                  
 21757                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21758                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21759                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 21760                                  
 21761                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21762                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 21763 000011B9 0000                    	dw	0
 21764                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21765                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 21766 000011BB 0000                    	dw	0	
 21767                                  
 21768                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 21769                                  
 21770                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 21771                                  
 21772                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6:  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:12F6h
 21773 000011BD 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 21774 000011BF 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 21774 000011C8 6C6F636174696F6E20-
 21774 000011D1 6572726F722024

 21776                                  end_sysinit_base: ; label byte
 21777                                  	; 24/10/2022

 21779                                  
 21780                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21781                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21782                                  ;
 21783                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21784                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21785                                  ;
 21786                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21787                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21788                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21789                                  ;
 21790                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21791                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21792                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21793                                  
 21794                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21795                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21796                                  
 21797                                  set_buffer:
 21798 000011D8 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21799 000011DA E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21800 000011DD 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21801                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 21802                                  	; 17/09/2023
 21803 000011DF FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 21804                                  set_buff_1:
 21805                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21806                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21807 000011E1 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21808                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21809 000011E3 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21810                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21811 000011E6 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21812                                  
 21813 000011EB 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21814 000011ED 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21815 000011F2 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21816                                  
 21817                                  ;	for each buffer
 21818                                  
 21819                                  nxt_buff:
 21820 000011F3 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 21821 000011F6 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 21822 000011F8 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 21823                                  
 21824 000011FA 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 21825                                  
 21826 000011FF 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 21827                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21828 00001200 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21829 00001203 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21830                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21831                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21832 00001205 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 21833                                  
 21834 00001209 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 21835 0000120B 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21836                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21837 0000120D C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21838 00001211 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21839                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of scratch buff is 0
 21840 00001215 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21841                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21842 0000121A 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21843 0000121D 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21844                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21845                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 21846                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 21847 00001221 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21848                                  set_buff_2:
 21849 00001224 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 21850                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 21851 00001229 2E800E[BD14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 21852                                  	;call	round
 21853                                  	;retn
 21854                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21855 0000122F E93D30                  	jmp	round
 21856                                  
 21857                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21858                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21859                                  ;
 21860                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21861                                  ;
 21862                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21863                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21864                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21865                                  
 21866                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21867                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21868 00001232 53                      	push	bx
 21869 00001233 52                      	push	dx
 21870 00001234 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21871 00001238 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21872                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21873 0000123D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21874                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21875                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21876                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21877 00001240 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21878 00001242 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21879 00001244 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21880                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21881 00001247 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21882 00001249 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21883 0000124C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 21884                                  
 21885                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21886                                  	; 05/09/2023
 21887                                  	; zf=1
 21888 0000124E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 21889                                  	; zf=1
 21890                                  	
 21891                                  	;zf=1
 21892                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21893                                  	;zf=1
 21894 0000124F 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21895                                  got_hma:
 21896 00001254 5A                      	pop	dx
 21897 00001255 5B                      	pop	bx
 21898 00001256 C3                      	retn

 21902                                  set_buffer_info:
 21903                                  
 21904                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 21905                                  ;
 21906                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 21907                                  ;    ax = di
 21908                                  ;
 21909                                  ;out:
 21910                                  ;    above entries set.
 21911

 21913 00001257 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 21914                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 21915 0000125C 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21916 00001260 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21917 00001264 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; adjust ax
 21918                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21919 00001269 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 21920                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 21921 0000126C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 21922                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21923 00001272 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21924                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21925 00001278 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 21926 0000127E C3                      	retn
 21927                                  
 21928                                  ; ======================================================================
 21929                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21930                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21931                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21932                                  
 21933                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21934                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21935                                  ;
 21936                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21937                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21938                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21939                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21940                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21941                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21942                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21943                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21944                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21945                                  ;
 21946                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21947                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21948                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21949                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21950                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21951                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21952                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21953                                  ;	conditions:
 21954                                  ;
 21955                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21956                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21957                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21958                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21959                                  ;
 21960                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21961                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21962                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21963                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21964                                  ;
 21965                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21966                                  ;
 21967                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21968                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21969                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21970                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21971                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21972                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21973                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21974                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21975                                  ;
 21976                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21977                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21978                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21979                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21980                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement stack logic in this case.
 21981                                  ;
 21982                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21983                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21984                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21985                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21986                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21987                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21988                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21989                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21990                                  ;
 21991                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21992                                  
 21993                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21994                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21995                                  
 21996                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21997                                  stackinit:
 21998 0000127F 50                      	push	ax
 21999 00001280 1E                      	push	ds
 22000 00001281 06                      	push	es
 22001 00001282 53                      	push	bx
 22002 00001283 51                      	push	cx
 22003 00001284 52                      	push	dx
 22004 00001285 57                      	push	di
 22005 00001286 56                      	push	si
 22006 00001287 55                      	push	bp
 22007                                  
 22008                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22009                                  
 22010                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22011                                  	; ds = cs
 22012 00001288 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22013 0000128B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22014                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22015                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22016                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22017 0000128D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22018                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22019 00001291 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22020 00001294 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22021                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22022 00001298 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22023                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22024                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22025                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22026 0000129B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22027                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22028 0000129F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22029 000012A1 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22030                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22031                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22032                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22033 000012A4 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22034                                  
 22035                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22036                                  
 22037                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22038                                  
 22039                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22040                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22041                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22042 000012A8 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22043                                  
 22044                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22045                                  
 22046 000012AD B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22047                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22048                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22049                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22050 000012B0 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22051 000012B2 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22052 000012B4 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22053 000012B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22054 000012BA 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22055                                  
 22056                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22057                                  
 22058 000012BD 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22059 000012C2 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22060 000012C6 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22061 000012C8 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22062 000012CA 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22063 000012CC 06                      	push	es
 22064 000012CD 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22065                                  
 22066                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22067                                  
 22068 000012CE 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22069 000012D2 FC                      	cld
 22070 000012D3 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22071                                  
 22072 000012D5 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22073                                  
 22074                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22075                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22076                                  ;  cx = number of entries

 22835                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22836                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22837                                  
 22838                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22839                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22840                                  
 22841                                  new_init_loop:
 22842                                  
 22843                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22844                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22845                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22846                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22847                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22848                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22849                                  
 22850 00001471 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22851 00001474 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22852 00001476 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22853 0000147A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22854                                  
 22855 0000147D 1E                      	push	ds
 22856                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22857                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22858                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22859 0000147E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22860 00001481 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22861 00001483 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22862 00001486 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22863 00001488 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22864 0000148C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 22865 0000148F 1F                      	pop	ds
 22866                                  
 22867 00001490 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22868 00001493 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22869 00001497 C3                      	retn
 22870                                  
 22871                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 23161                                  ;
 23162                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23163                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23164                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23165                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23166                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23167                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23168                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23169                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23170                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23171                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23172                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23173                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23174                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23175                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23176                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23177                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23178                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23179                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23180                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23181                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23182                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23183                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23184                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23185                                  ;	   :
 23186                                  ;
 23187                                  ;Note:
 23188                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23189                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23190                                  ;
 23191                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23192                                  ;
 23193                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23194                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23195                                  ;
 23196                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23197                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23198                                  ;
 23199                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23200                                  ;
 23201                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23202                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23203                                  ;
 23204                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23205                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23206                                  ;
 23207                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23208                                  ;
 23209                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23210                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23211                                  ;
 23212                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23213                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23214                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23215                                  ;
 23216                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23217                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23218                                  ;
 23219                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23220                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23221                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23222                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23223                                  
 23224                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23225                                  
 23226                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23227                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23228                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23229                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23230                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23231                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23232                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23233                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23234                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23235                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23236                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23237                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23238                                  
 23239                                  ;**** Function flags
 23240                                  
 23241                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23242                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23243                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23244                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23245                                  
 23246                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23247                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23248 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23249 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23250 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23251 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23252 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23253 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23254                                  endstruc
 23255                                  
 23256                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23257                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23258                                  ;
 23259                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23260                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23261                                  ;	     +-
 23262                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23263                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23264                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23265                                  ;	     |	:
 23266                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23267                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23268                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23269                                  ;	     |	:
 23270                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23271                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23272                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23273                                  ;	     +-	:
 23274                                  ;
 23275                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23276                                  ;
 23277                                  ;Note:
 23278                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23279                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23280                                  ;
 23281                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23282                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23283                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23284                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23285                                  
 23286                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23287                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23288                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23289                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23290                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23291                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23292                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23293                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23294                                  
 23295                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23296 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23297 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23298 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23299 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23300 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23301                                  endstruc
 23302                                  
 23303                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23304                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23305                                  ;
 23306                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23307                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23308                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23309                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23310                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23311                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23312                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23313                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23314                                  ;
 23315                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23316                                  ;
 23317                                  ;            +-
 23318                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23319                                  ;	    | or
 23320                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23321                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23322                                  ;	    | or
 23323                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23324                                  ;	    | or
 23325                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23326                                  ;	    | or
 23327                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23328                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23329                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23330                                  ;	    | or
 23331                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23332                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23333                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23334                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23335                                  ;	    +-
 23336                                  ;
 23337                                  ;
 23338                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23339                                  ;      list.
 23340                                  ;
 23341                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23342                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23343                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23344                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23345

 23350 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23351 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23352                                  endstruc

 23377                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 23378                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 23379                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 23380                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 23381                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23382                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23383                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line
