 26805                                  	;pop	ds
 26806                                  
 26807                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26808                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26809                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26810                                  ;install= command.
 26811                                  
 26812                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26813                                  ;install command
 26814                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26815                                  
 26816                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26817                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26818                                  tryi:
 26819 000020B9 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 26820 000020BE 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 26821 000020C0 E97F01                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 26822                                  not_init_pass:
 26823 000020C3 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 26824                                          ; 11/12/2022
 26825                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 26826 000020C8 74E5                    	je	short coff
 26827                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26828                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26829                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 26830                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 26831                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 26832                                  					; and before install= commands
 26833                                  					; are processed
 26834                                  
 26835 000020CA 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 26836 000020CF 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 26837 000020D1 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 26838                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26839                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 26840 000020D4 74D9                    	je	short coff
 26841                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26842                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26843                                  
 26844                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 26845                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 26846                                          
 26847 000020D6 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 26848                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26849 000020D9 7507                    	jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 26850                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26851                                  	;jne	short tryb	
 26852                                  	
 26853                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 26854 000020DB 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26855                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 26856 000020E0 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 26857                                  
 26858                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26859                                  ; (SYSINIT:2448h)
 26860                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26861                                  ;%if 0
 26862                                  precheck_installhigh:
 26863 000020E2 80FC57                  	cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 26864 000020E5 756B                    	jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 26865                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26866 000020E7 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26867 000020EC EBC1                    	jmp	short coff
 26868                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26869                                  
 26870                                  multi_try_i:
 26871 000020EE 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 26872                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 26873 000020F1 750A                    	jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 26874                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26875                                  	;jne	short multi_pass_filter
 26876                                  
 26877                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26878                                  ;%if 1 
 26879                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26880                                  ;%if 0
 26881                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26882 000020F3 E8A31F                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26883 000020F6 7241                    	jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26884                                  ;endif
 26885                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26886                                  
 26887 000020F8 E8D2EF                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26888 000020FB EBB2                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 26889                                  
 26890                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26891                                  ; (SYSINIT:2463h)
 26892                                  ;%if 1
 26893                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26894                                  ;%if 0
 26895                                  
 26896                                  multi_try_n:
 26897 000020FD 80FC57                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 26898 00002100 7537                            jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 26899                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26900 00002102 E8941F                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26901 00002105 7232                            jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26902                                  ;endif
 26903                                  
 26904                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 26905                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 26906                                  
 26907 00002107 B80058                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 26908 0000210A CD21                    	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 26909 0000210C 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 26910 0000210E 53                              push    bx                      ; save for the return
 26911                                  
 26912 0000210F 81CB8000                        or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 26913 00002113 B80158                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 26914 00002116 CD21                    	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 26915                                  
 26916 00002118 B80258                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26917 0000211B CD21                            int     21h                     ; get link state
 26918 0000211D 30E4                            xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26919 0000211F 50                              push    ax                      ; save for return
 26920                                  
 26921 00002120 B80358                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26922 00002123 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 26923 00002126 CD21                    	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26924                                  
 26925 00002128 E8A2EF                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26926                                  
 26927 0000212B B80358                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26928 0000212E 5B                              pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26929 0000212F CD21                            int     21h
 26930 00002131 5B                              pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26931 00002132 B80158                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26932 00002135 CD21                            int     21h
 26933                                  
 26934                                  	;jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 26935                                  	; 01/01/2023
 26936 00002137 EBA7                    	jmp	short multi_pass_coff2
 26937                                  
 26938                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26939                                  
 26940                                  multi_pass_filter:
 26941 00002139 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 26942 0000213C 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26943 0000213E 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 26944 00002141 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26945 00002143 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM     ; '0' ; rem?
 26946 00002146 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 26947                                  
 26948                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 26949 00002148 FF0E[5A03]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 26950 0000214C FF06[5603]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 26951                                  
 26952                                  multi_pass_coff:
 26953                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26954                                  	;jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.
 26955                                  	; 01/01/2023
 26956 00002150 EB8E                    	jmp	short multi_pass_coff2
 26957                                  
 26958                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26959                                  ; buffer command
 26960                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26961                                  
 26962                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26963                                  ;									      *
 26964                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26965                                  ;									      *
 26966                                  ; input :								      *
 26967                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26968                                  ; output:								      *
 26969                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26970                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26971                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26972                                  ;									      *
 26973                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26974                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26975                                  ; logic:								      *
 26976                                  ; {									      *
 26977                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26978                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26979                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26980                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26981                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26982                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26983                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26984                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26985                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26986                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26987                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26988                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26989                                  ;	};								      *
 26990                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26991                                  ; };									      *
 26992                                  ;									      *
 26993                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26994                                  
 26995                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26996                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26997                                  tryb:
 26998 00002152 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26999 00002155 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 27000                                  
 27001                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 27004                                  ;%if 0
 27005                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 27008                                  ;endif
 27009                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022

 27012                                  	; 18/12/2022

 27016

 27024                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 27025                                  	;;jmp	short sr7

 27029                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27030 0000216A E9A606                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27031                                  if7:
 27032 0000216D 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 27033 00002170 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 27034                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x ; (/X switch)
 27035 00002172 813E[711D][661D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 27036                                  	;jne	short if11
 27037                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27038 00002178 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 27039                                  
 27040                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 27041                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 27042                                  if11:
 27043                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 27044 0000217A A1[731D]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]
 27045 0000217D 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1
 27046 00002180 7505                    	jne	short if13
 27047

 27050                                  	; 31/12/2022

 27065 0000219C EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 27066                                  if18:
 27067 0000219E A1[691D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.

 27084                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27085                                  ; break command
 27086                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27087                                  
 27088                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27089                                  ;									    *
 27090                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27091                                  ;									    *
 27092                                  ; input :								    *
 27093                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27094                                  ; output:								    *
 27095                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27096                                  ;									    *
 27097                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27098                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27099                                  ; logic:								    *
 27100                                  ; {									    *
 27101                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27102                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27103                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27104                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27105                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27106                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 27107                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 27108                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27109                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 27110                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 27111                                  ;	};								    *
 27112                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 27113                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 27114                                  ; };									    *
 27115                                  ;									    *
 27116                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27117                                  
 27118                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27119                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 27120                                  tryc:
 27121 000021B3 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 27122 000021B6 7539                    	jne	short trym
 27123                                  
 27124                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27125                                  ; (SYSINIT:2527h)
 27126                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27127                                  ;%if 0
 27128                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27129 000021B8 E8DE1E                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27130 000021BB 7234                    	jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27131                                  ;endif
 27132                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27133                                  
 27134 000021BD BF[771D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 27135 000021C0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27136                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27137                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27138                                  do22:
 27139 000021C2 E81F07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27140 000021C5 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 27141                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 27142                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 27143                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27144                                  ;sr22:
 27145                                  	;jmp	coff
 27146                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27147 000021C7 E94906                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27148                                  if22:
 27149 000021CA 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 27150 000021CD 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 27151                                  
 27152                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 27153 000021CF 803E[701D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 27154 000021D4 7507                    	jne	short if26
 27155

 27757                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 27758                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 27759                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 27760                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 27761                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 27762                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
 27763                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.
 27764                                  ;

 27766                                  ;	driver to access the DblSpace drive letters, whether

 28698                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28699                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28700                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28701                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28702                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28703                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28704                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28705                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28706                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28707                                  
 28708                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28709                                  ;									  *
 28710                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28711                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28712                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28713                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28714                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28715                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28716                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28717                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28718                                  ; input :								  *
 28719                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28720                                  ; output:								  *
 28721                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28722                                  ;									  *
 28723                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28724                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28725                                  ; logic:								  *
 28726                                  ; {									  *
 28727                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28728                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28729                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28730                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28731                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28732                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28733                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28734                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28735                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28736                                  ;	     }								  *
 28737                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28738                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 28739                                  ;	};								  *
 28740                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28741                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28742                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 28743                                  ; };									  *
 28744                                  ;**************************************************************************

 29491                                  sysinit_parse:
 29492                                  
 29493                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29494                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 29495                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 29496                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 29497                                  ;
 29498                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 29499                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 29500                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29501                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29502                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29503                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29504                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29505                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29506                                  ;	 procedure.
 29507                                  ;	ax - exit code
 29508                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 29509                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 29510                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 29511                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 29512                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29513

 29859                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29860                                  ;

 29862                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29863                                  ;

 29868                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29869                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29870                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 29881 0000298F 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29882                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29883                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB

 29900                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29901                                  ;
 29902                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29903                                  ;
 29904                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29905                                  ;	Output : none
 29906                                  ;
 29907                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29908                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29909                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29910                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29911                                  ;
 29912                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29913                                  
 29914                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29915                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29916 0000299B 1E                      	push	ds
 29917 0000299C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29918 0000299F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29919 000029A1 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29920 000029A5 2E891E[7F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29921 000029AA B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29922 000029AC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29923 000029AE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29924 000029B1 2EC606[7E1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29925 000029B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 29926                                  ;limx:
 29927 000029B8 C3                      	retn
 29928                                  
 29929                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29930                                  ;
 29931                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29932                                  ;
 29933                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29934                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29935                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29936                                  ;
 29937                                  ;	Output : none
 29938                                  ;
 29939                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29940                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29941                                  ;
 29942                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29943                                  
 29944                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29945                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29946                                  	; ds = cs
 29947 000029B9 803E[7E1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29948                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29949                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29950                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29951 000029BE 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29952                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29953 000029C0 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29954 000029C3 8826[7E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29955                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29956                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29957 000029C7 1E                      	push	ds
 29958                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29959 000029C8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29960 000029CA 2EA1[7F1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29961 000029CE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12h memory
 29962 000029D1 1F                      	pop	ds
 29963                                  timx:
 29964 000029D2 C3                      	retn

 30017                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30018                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30019                                  
 30020                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30021                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30022                                  
 30023                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30024                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30025                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30026                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30027                                  
 30028                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30029                                  ;
 30030                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30031                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30032                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30033                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30034                                  ;
 30035                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30036                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30037                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30038                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30039                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30040                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30041                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30042                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30043                                  ; available during the load.
 30044                                  ;
 30045                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30046                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30047                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30048                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30049                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30050                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30051                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30052                                  ;
 30053                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30054                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30055                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30056                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30057                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30058                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30059                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30060                                  ;
 30061                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30062                                  
 30063                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30064                                  
 30065                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30066                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30067                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30068                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30069                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30070                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30071                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30072                                  
 30073                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30074                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30075                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30076                                  
 30077                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30078                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30079                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30080                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30081                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30082                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30083                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30084                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30085                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30086                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30087                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30088                                  
 30089                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30090                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30091                                  
 30092                                  InitVar:
 30093                                  	; 01/01/2023

 30100                                  	;push	di

 30102                                  
 30103                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment

 30105 000029FF 07                      	pop	es
 30106                                  
 30107 00002A00 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30108                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30109                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30110                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30111                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30112                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30113                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30114                                  
 30115                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30116                                  	; ds = cs
 30117 00002A02 A2[261F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30118 00002A05 A2[251F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30119 00002A08 A3[271F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30120 00002A0B C606[291F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30121                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB

 30123                                  
 30124 00002A13 FC                      	cld

 30146                                  
 30147                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30148                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30149                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30150                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30151                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30152                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30153                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30154                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30155                                  
 30156                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30157                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30158                                  FixMem:
 30159                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30160                                  	;push	ax
 30161                                  	;push	bx
 30162                                  	;push	cx
 30163                                  	;push	dx
 30164 00002A25 06                      	push	es
 30165                                  
 30166 00002A26 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30167                                  
 30168 00002A29 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30169 00002A2C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30170                                  
 30171 00002A2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30172                                  
 30173                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30174                                  
 30175 00002A30 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30176 00002A32 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30177 00002A34 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30178                                  
 30179                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30180                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30181                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30182                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30183                                  
 30184 00002A35 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30185 00002A39 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30186 00002A3E 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30187 00002A40 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30188                                  
 30189                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30190                                  
 30191 00002A42 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30192 00002A47 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30193 00002A49 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30194                                  
 30195 00002A4D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30196                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30197                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30198 00002A52 43                      	inc	bx

 30291                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30292                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30293                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30294                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30295                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30296                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30297                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30298                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30299                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30300                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30301                                  ;
 30302                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30303                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30304                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30305                                  ;
 30306                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30307                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30308                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30309                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30310                                  ;
 30311                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30312                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30313                                  ;
 30314                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30315                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30316                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30317                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30318                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30319                                  ;     lh
 30320                                  ;     /l
 30321                                  ;     1
 30322                                  ;     1000
 30323                                  ;     2
 30324                                  ;     print
 30325                                  ;     /d
 30326                                  ;     :lpt2
 30327                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30328                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30329                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30330                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30331                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30332                                  ; for:
 30333                                  ;    Each /L
 30334                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30335                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30336                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30337                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30338                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30339                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30340                                  
 30341                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30342                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30343                                  
 30344                                  ParseVar:
 30345                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30346                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30347                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30348 00002A8F 1E                      	push	ds
 30349 00002A90 06                      	push	es
 30350                                  
 30351 00002A91 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30352 00002A92 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30353 00002A93 FC                      	cld
 30354                                  
 30355                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30356                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30357                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30358                                  
 30359 00002A94 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30360 00002A95 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 30361 00002A98 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30362                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30363 00002A9A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30364 00002A9C 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30365                                  
 30366 00002A9E 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30367 00002A9F F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30368 00002AA0 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30369                                  pv20:	
 30370 00002AA2 AC                      	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30371                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30372 00002AA3 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 30373                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30374 00002AA5 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30375 00002AA7 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 30376                                  
 30377                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30378 00002AA9 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30379                                  
 30380                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30381                                  	;
 30382                                  	;push	es
 30383                                  	;push	cs
 30384                                  	;pop	es
 30385                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30386                                  	;pop	es
 30387                                  
 30388 00002AAE 2EC606[261F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30389                                  
 30390 00002AB4 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30391                                  
 30392                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30393 00002AB6 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then it's a bad
 30394 00002AB8 750D                    	jne	short pvE1	; switch!
 30395                                  
 30396                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30397 00002ABA 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30398                                  
 30399 00002ABF E80E00                  	call	parseL
 30400 00002AC2 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30401                                  
 30402 00002AC4 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30403 00002AC5 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30404                                  
 30405                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30406 00002AC7 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30407 00002ACA 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 30408 00002ACB 4E                      	dec	si
 30409 00002ACC F9                      	stc
 30410                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30411 00002ACD 07                      	pop	es
 30412 00002ACE 1F                      	pop	ds
 30413                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30414                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30415 00002ACF C3                      	retn
 30416                                  
 30417                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30418                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30419                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30420                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30421                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30422                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30423                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30424                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30425                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30426                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30427                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax. The 3-character rewind
 30428                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30429                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30430                                  
 30431                                  parseL:
 30432 00002AD0 AC                      	lodsb
 30433 00002AD1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30434 00002AD3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30435                                  
 30436                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30437                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30438                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30439                                  
 30440 00002AD5 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, it's ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30441 00002AD8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30442 00002ADA E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30443                                  
 30444 00002ADD 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30445 00002ADF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30446 00002AE2 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30447                                  
 30448                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30449 00002AE4 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30450                                  
 30451 00002AE9 AC                      	lodsb
 30452 00002AEA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30453 00002AEC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30454                                  
 30455 00002AEE E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30456 00002AF1 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30457

 30459 00002AF6 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30460                                  
 30461                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30462 00002AF8 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30463 00002AFA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30464                                  
 30465 00002AFC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30466 00002AFE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30467                                  
 30468                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30469                                  
 30470 00002B00 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30471 00002B03 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30472                                  
 30473 00002B05 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30474                                  
 30475 00002B08 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30476                                  
 30477                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30478 00002B0B 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30479                                  
 30480 00002B10 AC                      	lodsb
 30481 00002B11 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30482 00002B13 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 30483                                  
 30484 00002B15 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 30485 00002B18 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 30486                                  
 30487 00002B1A E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 30488 00002B1D 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30489                                  
 30490                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30491 00002B1F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 30492 00002B21 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 30493                                  plE1:	
 30494                                  	;mov	ax,1
 30495 00002B23 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 30496 00002B26 4E                      	dec	si
 30497 00002B27 F9                      	stc
 30498 00002B28 C3                      	retn
 30499                                  
 30500                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 30501 00002B29 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 30502                                  	; 12/12/2022

 30506                                  plSwX:

 30508                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 30509                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022

 30511                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 30512 00002B2E C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.

 30539                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30540                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30541                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30542                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30543                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30544                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30545                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30546                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30547                                  
 30548                                  isEOL:

 30550 00002B31 7406                    	je	short ieX
 30551 00002B33 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 30552 00002B35 7402                    	je	short ieX

 30554                                  ieX:	
 30555 00002B39 C3                      	retn
 30556                                  
 30557                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30558                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 30559                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30560                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30561                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains space, tab, or equals
 30562                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30563                                  ; USES:     ZF

 30570 00002B40 7402                    	je	short iwX

 30572                                  iwX:

 30626                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30627                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 30628                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 30629                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 30630                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 30631                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30632                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 30633                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30634                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 30635                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30636                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30637                                  
 30638                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30639                                  stowUMB:

 30641 00002B5A 7202                    	jb	short su10
 30642 00002B5C F9                      	stc

 30644                                  su10:	
 30645                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30646                                  	;push	bx

 30648                                  	;push	si
 30649                                  	;push	ds

 30651                                  	;push	cs

 30665                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before

 30668                                  su20:

 30679                                  
 30680                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 30681                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30682 00002B74 2E8687[2A1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 30683                                  
 30684                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 30685                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.

 30687                                  	;stc			; OOOPS! This one's been used before. :(
 30688                                  	
 30689                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30690 00002B79 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 30691 00002B7B F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 30692                                  su30:	
 30693                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30694                                  	;pop	es
 30695                                  	;pop	ds
 30696                                  	;pop	si
 30697                                  	;pop	di
 30698                                  	;pop	bx
 30699 00002B7C C3                      	retn
 30700

 30702                                  %if 0
